column1: a bit of width outside off, testing the bounce in the pitch, Bancroft leaves alone
tighter line on off stump, Bancroft squares up to defend

huge appeal! Wow, Bancroft played all around that, so full, angled into the stumps, Morkel went up twice, he was so convinced, but umpire Dharmasena was unmoved. We go for a review, and sure enough, that was hopping high over the leg stump... plenty of bounce, clearly, though Morkel would have preferred some skid...
full again, tapped into the leg side, pinned on the crease for now
and now the edge - controlled this time - as Morkel pulls his length back to attack the splice. Three slips in place, and the second of them fields the ball on the bounce
full and attacking, speared into the toes, and squeezed into the off side. That's a very feisty first over
full and floaty to launch his spell, dipping on the crease as Warner leans forward to defend
outside off, tapped into the off side, taking the pace off the ball, and an instant call. Good running as the shy comes in from the covers
big swing from a full length, but Bancroft is comfortably forward, steering a calm drive into the covers to get off the mark
a crunching drive from a very full, inswinging length. Short cover wears the shot rather than fields it. But no run either way
outswinger this time, Warner picks it early and lets it go
through to the keeper once more, a probing start from both ends
bouncer, the first of the morning. Good morning indeed, Mr Bancroft. He ducks, shrugs, and takes his guard again
lovely strike, Morkel strays in line, a freebie on the pads, and whittled through backward square with a cuff of the wrists
full and probing, attacking the base of the stumps, punched on the up to mid-on
a bit of width outside off, no stroke offered
in the blockhole, attacking the base of the stumps, punched to mid-on
banged in short once more, but well wide of off stump and swinging away
threatening swing from Philander, so hard to line up, especially when he bowls a full length. Poked to the off side with soft hands
solidly forward, smothering the lateral movement with a big stride and firm block
defended once more, very cautious in these early stages
full, and threatening to swing back through the left-hander's gate. Warner is striding into an attacking position, then has to cover up at the last minute
fully forward once more to defend
aggression this time from Warner, and that constant threat that he poses pays dividends. Slightly overpitched, so he unleashes his forearms and biffs a drive through long-off
squared up on the back foot, poked to cover
leaning onto the front foot to defend
very full, tailing into the stumps, blocked into the off side
banged in short, over the shoulder as Bancroft ducks
nudged off the toes out to midwicket
back of a length, good bounce on off stump, tapped to point with a half-committed stride
lines up the inswinger but misdirects the line, tails into the pads and tucked behind square
good leave! Or fortunate... who knows. Either way, Warner left a very full ball on length, and the ball just hopped over the top of off...
solidly onto the front foot, a smothering stride to defend back to the bowler
thumped pleasingly out through the covers, not hitting the ball too hard, but piercing the off-side ring all the same

got him! Perfect bowling from Philander, outside off, climbing off the deck with a hint of outswing, kissing the edge and de Kock does the rest! Bancroft's non-existent form continues, and South Africa have their first incision ...
outside off, a hint of outswing, deflected into the off side
banged in short, on the hip, nudged round the corner, there is thought of a second run but they opt against it
on the pads once more, another tickle to backward square
absolutely battered! Too much width, full length, Warner climbs into a Popeye-forearmed drive through the covers. No holds barred!
tighter line, much better, and blocked to the off side on the back foot
bouncing off an awkward length, into the hip, and squeezed uncomfortably to the leg side
'wait on ... yes!' is the call, as Warner defends stoutly straight back down the pitch, and pauses for a beat to be sure that the ball has eluded Morkel in his followthrough
through to the keeper as Warner leaves alone on the angle
striding forward to block back down the pitch
on the pads, flipped urgently into the leg side
very full, a hint of wobble on a full length, Warner defends with a loosely held blade, on the front foot
probing stuff from Philander, targetting the edge, and nudged into the gap
cracked on the up, out to point. Looking to be positive
squared up on the back foot, poked softly to the leg side
that's a properly sharp bouncer! Over the wicket to the left-hander, across the bows and leaping at the lid. Khawaja watches it late then hauls his neck out of harm's way
cracked fiercely through the covers! No qualms about getting back onto the front foot following the short ball, head over the ball, bat flowing through. Lovely
another short ball, this time swinging harmlessly over the shoulder and down the leg side

leg-sided once again ... de Kock gathers the ball and tosses it high in a fairly convincing appeal. Warner's response is to look for the single! Nothing doing, but good intent from the vice-captain...
solid in defence once more
tapped into the covers, and through for the single
too short, and leathered through the leg side with a dismissive pull. A bit powder-puffy from Philander, just skidded on nicely and begged to be spanked
over the wicket, fuller length, and ghosts a late outswinger past a tentative edge. That's more like it from Vern!
on the pads, nudged to short midwicket
full length, solid block
through to the keeper once more.

and a huge appeal first up! Another review coming up, and well, this looked incredibly close. Big grip from outside off, hits the back leg, which could be crucial ... and there's no inside edge, so are the timbers going to be shivered... and it is missing! South Africa have burned both of their reviews in the first hour!
stretching forward to block on a good length
another big stride, and a respectful block, into the covers. That first-up ripper was a big warning shot
flipped off the pads to square leg
blocked once more, more big rip from the footholes as Warner works with the spin
pushed right back onto the stumps to defend
very full, 143kph already, blocked on the crease line
extra pace, 147kph this time, but Khawaja is unmoved by the speedometer. Slightly off-line and whipped emphatically through midwicket. Top shot
stoutly forward on off stump, 149kph, he's getting quicker with every ball. Pushed to mid-off

edged, and that is a stunning grab from the keeper! Rabada was getting closer with every ball, and fourth-up, he found the ideal length to match his fizzing pace. Angled across the left-hander, demanding the stroke, and de Kock did outstandingly to salmon-leap in front of first slip and snaffle the chance in an outstretched left mitt!
inswinger on the off stump, firmly blocked
edged and through third man! Off the mark, but not in the ideal fashion... but they all count
uses the feet, charges down to put pressure on the bowler and punches one wide of mid-off
round the wicket, tossed up on off and blocked
looped up, straightening a touch on off, Smith gets forward
flighted, Smith dances out this time, whips the ball to the right of mid-on and hustles the single
gives this some air, wide of the stumps and Warner sticks out his front leg, lets it pass by
tossed up nice and slow, Warner blocks on off
glides in and hits a length, Smith gets across
slightly back of a length, 14o clicks and kicks like a Moscow mule as Smith rides the bounce
shortish, defended down into the leg side
perfect length, 141kph/88mph around off, shaping in a touch as Smith plants the front foot and defends to extra cover
hangs this slightly wider, good length but Smith lets it go
angled in with the arm and Smith taps it away to the on side
flighted, touch too full and Warner seizes on it, the jaws snap shut as he clunks four through point, punchy drive and there's no one out there
tossed up straighter and Warner comes down, works through mid-on - that's the Australia 50 up
full and flighted, wristy flick from Smith but he picks out midwicket
flatter, comes across and pushes to cover
tossed up and defended towards mid-off coming forwards
gives it some air, Smith again looks to hit against the spin, whips it hard to midwicket

banged in short, Warner gets in a tangle on the hook... but gets it away safely between the two men out for the catch! Took his eye off but played it well in the end, that flew between deep square and fine leg
hammers a length, 145kph and Warner gets into line
woof, that's nearly decapitated Quinny de Kock! A good leave from Warner and it has exploded from a length, climbed over off stump and kept rising
touch too straight and worked off his pads
pitched up, speared in on off stump, Smith rambles across and works to midwicket
length ball, 146kph/91mph around off stump and defended
tossed up outside the line, pushed into the covers coming across
spinning in, blocked on off stump
flighted, Warner is dancing down again, punched through mid-on
tossed up, little bit of turn as Smith stretches out, played off the outer half of the bat to backward point
nice and slow, straightening on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
lobbed up and Smith latches on to this, clipped with wristy impunity high over midwicket and away for four
length ball, comes across and blocks
angled on off, Warner pushes into the off side
length ball, trying to drag Warner over to the off side, he stubs it down towards cover again
slightly tighter line, 138kph and Warner defends
now goes for the nip-backer, extra heat at 147kph/91mph, Warner stays back and gets a thick inside edge to the leg side for one
giving nothing away here, back of a length and blocked on off
tossed up from over the wicket and blocked
spinning back in and defended playing back
flighted, around the line of off and driven, Maharaj gets a hand on it and the ball rolls to mid-off
tries to batter this through the covers, skipping down but flaying a drive straight to the fielder
tight lines and this is tapped away
floated up around off stump, defended
good pace and carry in the channel outside off, wide enough to leave
touch short of a length, 148kph and Smith gets into line to block
short, width on offer and Smith jumps at the chance, mistimes a chop in front of point
dug in, lacking some oomph, though, 130kph and Smith limbers up to crunch a pull wide of fine leg
short, rising to hit the thigh pad as Smith hops across his stumps
good length, 143kph and defended towards mid-off
flighted, turning in from out of Rabada's footmarks, Warner defends
drops a touch short, Warner rocks on to the cut and gets it away in front of square, Amla gives chase and pulls it in before the rope
flat on the stumps, punched through mid-on
floated up from round the wicket, punched to cover
full and flighted, tapped back
Smith gets him away again, brings out his own personal protractor and whisks Maharaj from outside off through midwicket for another boundary
only a touch short but this is superbly played, Warner just opens the face and uses the pace of Rabada, guided through gully for four to third man
fullish, quick and bouncy, hung outside off but left alone this time
length on the pads, 149kph and Warner skims it fine of the man on the rope for a couple more
too straight from Rabada again and Warner clips through midwicket for another brace
better line, 140-plus on a length around middle and off, shows it a straight blade
sliding down the leg side again and Warner flicks fine for two more
round the wicket, floated up full outside off, stabbed into the covers
slows his pace up, straighter line and pushed down the ground as he comes forward on middle and leg
tossed up on the stumps and nurdled for one
gives it some air, outside the line of off and defended
Smith presses on to the front foot to block
tossed up on the stumps and Smith crabbily flicks it away through midwicket for one more
short of a length, 137kph and worked off the body
Warner gets across and taps it away
staying over the wicket, 145kph on a length around middle and off, defended stoutly back to the bowler
pushed through in the corridor, Warner prods it into a gap for one

ooh, is that a misjudgment from Smith...? No stroke played, hit on the pads outside off, Morkel implores for lbw, but S Ravi is unmoved - rather like Smith, who shakes his head and looks disgusted you would even ask the question. Looked high, actually and probably didn't come back enough
fuller, angling in and met solidly coming forwards
wobbles in and puts it on a length, Warner gets across his stumps
length ball in the channel, this one zips through
good length around off, 136kph and Warner judiciously dabs it down into the off side
tight to off stump, looking for a little nibble either way, hits the inside half of the bat as Warner defends
keeper up to the stumps now... and Warner responds by sitting deep in the crease and thrashing a cut away through gully to raise his half-century! No warm-up matches, no problem for Davey W
probing away on a length, defended
length, climbing through outside off, Smith lets it be
closer to the stumps but again he can factor in Morkel's extra bounce, 140kph and flying through
back of a length outside off ans again he can't persuade Smith to engage
pitched up a touch more, 137kph/85mph but wide again and Smith ignores after doing his familiar do-si-do across the stumps
short of a length, driven off the back foot into the covers
goes straight now, into Smith's areas and he uses the pace against the bowler, 144kph but just a tap on the backside sends it skimming to fine leg. Welcome to Smiffy's world
de Kock still up as Philander trundles in, blocked on the stumps
tight lines, little bit of seam movement and Warner shows it a straight bat
Warner shuffles into line and clamps down in defence
middle-and-leg line, Warner works it off his pads
diligent lines from Big Vern, blocked back down the track once more

gottim! Philander strikes, Warner fending a lifter to second slip! A punch in the gut for Australia, just as they were preparing to sit down for their vittles... Yeesh, didn't see that coming, so compact and watchful has Warner been. The ball just bit into the surface and rose more than expected, took the shoulder of the bat and flew to de Villiers, who was also standing fairly close but clasped it safely as he tottered back. Some extra sauce for SA at the interval
on the off stump, tailing in, blocked with soft hands back down the pitch
tailing into the toes, clipped with the angle out through square leg
another whipped flick through midwicket. There's a leg slip in place but this angle is bread-and-butter to Smith
outside off stump, enough width for Smith to leave well alone
another leg-stump freebie for Smith, and whipped with alacrity through midwicket. These tactics are ... peculiar
full length, tailing in towards the blockhole. A better line but an expensive over
swinging into the pads, and helped into the leg side
through to the keeper, outside off stump this time. Good carry and a hint of movement
good areas once again, outside off, staying a touch low this time
well bowled, appreciable nibble off the seam from back of a length. Marsh comes half-forward and has to adjust to defend to cover
back of a length, met with feet in no-man's land as Marsh tries not to over-commit. Blocked back down the pitch
left alone, extravagant windscreen-wiper of a leave. Hops over the top of off stump as Marsh judges the length well
outside off, back of a length, punched with loose forearms into the covers
stout block on the line of off stump once more
flung out, well wide of off stump. Smith sizes it up but lets it go
width once more, but much shorter this time. Smith has all the time in the world to rise up onto his toes and pick off his first runs through the off side
fuller and tighter line, no stroke this time as the ball dies through to de Kock. The nip seems to be going out of this pitch as the ball gets older
full length, wide line, through to the keeper
tight line to the left-hander from over the wicket. Met on the back foot for another dot ball, the seventh of his brief stay
back of a length, outside off, Smith hauls his bat out of harm's way with a big arcing leave
stabbed out to cover with urgent footwork
full and straight, on the spot once more with de Kock standing up to the stumps to give Marsh something more to think of
good nip off the deck this time as Philander finds extra swing across Marsh's bows. De Kock gets his gloves in the way but can't gather cleanly
full and leg-sided, a poor finish to the over as Marsh gets his first runs with a neat tuck through square leg
short and thrashed through midwicket with a languid pick-up-and-pull! Saw the length so early and pivoted into the stroke like a latter-day Ricky Ponting
on the back foot, waiting for the short, straighter delivery. Blocked
fuller length, wider line, Smith engages but lets it go
opens the face and glides through third man. Technically an edge, but beautifully soft hands so always going down
stabbed into the off side
no way through
plugging away on that line outside off, swinging the ball towards de Kock's gloves as he lurks right behind the batsman
a hint of movement off the seam as Marsh lets that one thud into the keeper's gloves
well bowled again, tailing away to the left-hander on a very tight line
forward and poked into the covers
keeps a touch low after seaming across the left-hander. Lining him up nicely for the inswinger here ...
that's a beauty. Big swing and seam from a good off-stump line and length. Marsh keeps his bat just about inside the line as de Kock gathers
up onto the toes, blocked back down the pitch
good length delivery, left alone outside off
no stroke once more as Rabada plugs away
through to the keeper, extra nip off the seam
clipped off the pads, out through square leg
forward once more but leaving well alone outside off stump
good nip off the deck, Smith inside-edges into his thigh as he hops across his crease to defend
keeps low on off stump, Smith exaggerates his defensive block to make the point as the ball skews out to square leg

driven on the up, and dropped at gully, a really tough chance! Big movement away from Smith as he was lured into the stroke, and de Villiers couldn't scoop the ball low in his left hand as he stretched backwards
stabbed into the off side, more solidly behind the ball this time
swing from the hand, Smith lines it up and ignores it outside off
very full, looping towards the toes as Smith plays French Cricket to punch it into the off side
round the wicket, full length, cautious defence into the gully region
soft hands on the back foot to defend back to the bowler
that's a sumptuous smite through the covers! Just enough width to free the arms, and Marsh played it supremely, at the top of the bounce, to pick off a second boundary
tighter line, fuller length, drawn forward with bat and pad together to block to mid-off
on the back foot, blocked back down the pitch
on the back foot from round the wicket, made to hustle by some extra bounce
firmly onto the front foot
a hint of width once more, and Smith is drawn into something more extravagant. Can't time his back-foot punch though
swing, and a mother of leaves from Smith, who finishes with his bat pointing ostentatiously towards the midwicket floodlights
squared up on the front foot, blocked back down the pitch
no stroke once more
hint of swing away from the right-hander, left alone again. Another maiden
a swishy drive to a probing full length, gathered in Keshav's followthrough
flipped on the up through midwicket
tossed up outside off, and drifting in. A flogged drive into the covers
poked out to backward square
working with the spin, picked up on the leg side
drilled to mid-off, good intent, but no way through
good areas straightaway, on off stump and maybe just a hint of reverse as Smith blocks watchfully
too wide to tempt a stroke this time, keeps low as de Kock scoops up behind the stumps
better line and length, much fuller and on a fourth-stump line. Smith lets it go
pounding out a good length, outside off. Still no stroke
tailing into the stumps, blocked to the off side
good areas once again, wide on the crease and attacking the stumps, Ntini-style. Definite hints of reverse swing towards the end of that over as Smith hangs back in his crease to counter the threat
tossed up and poked back to the bowler
squeezed back down the pitch
flipped in the air for a split-second, towards the very close catcher at silly mid-on. But just short
worked to the leg side with good wrists
striding onto the front foot and stabbed back to the bowler
probing areas, round the wicket, threatening to pop from a good length under the batsman's eyeline. Fenced into the covers
lifting off the deck from back of a length, Marsh won't be tempted there
short and too wide, this time Marsh knows the shot is on, an emphatic back-foot spank past gully
outside off, better carry off the deck. Through to the keeper
that's the length, a touch too wide but tailing away, and forcing Marsh to make a decision. This time, the decision is to leave
huge appeal! Perfect length again, and this time bursts back off the seam, thudding Marsh's pad, but they've used all their reviews! Probably going over, indeed it was...
into line to block
tossed up, and tapped down to long-on
on the pads, nudged behind square
round the wicket, a teasing line on off stump and threatening to turn. Blocked
tapped back to the bowler, no liberties from Australia's batsmen
leaning onto the front foot, beaten outside off this time
solid stride to meet the full length, head right over the ball to see off the threat
Rabada continues round the wicket, 136kph just back of a length outside off, Marsh shows it the maker's name
fuller, draws Marsh on to the front foot, holding its line outside off as he shoulders arms
dug in, 146kph but it bounces high and leg side and the batsman can evade
back of a length outside off, waved through again
short and wide, 143kph but Marsh can't collar the cut and picks out point
Marsh plants the front foot and defends to cover
tossed up and nudged into a gap, Smith trots through to bring up his fifty, another granite knock - and, ominously, he tends to go on. Of his last 12 50-plus scores, eight have been converted
over the wicket to Marsh, who flicks a single square
tossed up and Smith sashays down the pitch, works the ball past midwicket and it races away
tapped back down the track
steps out to block on the front foot
Maharaj gets a little straight, Smith whips square but picks out the fielder
back of a length, 141kph and defended to the on side
dug in and Marsh pulls, sweetly struck but Maharaj hunts ti down into the deep to prevent four
in the channel, slightly too wide to induce a stroke
full, sprayed into the pads and Smith skelps it aerially down to fine leg for one more

fires in the attempted yorker, Marsh is falling over... but not given by umpire Dharmasena! Was there some bat involved? Looked mighty close to hitting leg stump, but SA of course don't have any reviews left. It did hit the bat, but only after thumping the front pad
on the stumps and dropped for one
tossed up from over the wicket, defended
flighted, uses the feet and works through mid-on for one
Smith gets on to the front foot and defends
tossed up on off and again Smith is happy to smother it
angled in, comes across and taps the ball away
floated full on off, again Smith gets forward to play with a straight bat
short of a length, fading away in the channel as Marsh leaves
angled in straighter and defended to leg
in the corridor, back of a length again, lets it through
banged in, steepling bouncer but it passes harmlessly down the leg side
length ball, 138kph and sliding into the body as Marsh scoots across and clips one square
over the wicket, goes for the rib-tickler but Smith is waltzing across and out of the way as it veers leg side
flighed, whipped with the spin towards midwicket, taken smartly and there's a roar from the crowd (audible, however small) - but it was a bump ball
goes back and works the ball between the two men leg side
tossed up and nudged for one
flighted, on the stumps and worked to leg
tossed up and tapped away
flat on the stumps, prodded back to the bowler
short outside off, Smith moves across and leaves alone
fuller, angling in and pushed into the covers
full, 137kph and lashed into the covers, well fielded on the dive by Aiden Markram at extra cover to prevent a run
again gets him coming forward, struck without timing into the off side
short and wide of the stumps, Smith practically does the Macarena in response before shouldering arms
banged in halfway down, climbing over off stump, 135kph... ducked
tossed up and pushed back towards the bowler
waits in the crease and works the ball square for a single
tossed up and stroked into the off side

oh, someone pass the Kryptonite - Smith is gone! Jubilation among the SA players as umpire Ravi's finger goes up and Smith stalks from the field. Needed a bit of luck but Maharaj has made the breakthrough; Smith was trying to cut, got a thick edge that deflected into and out of de Kock's gloves but then ballooned up for de Villiers to jog from slip and bag safely. Smith won't convert this time, SA have landed the big one
pushed through, touch short outside off and Marsh absolutely crunches the ball through point for four from his first delivery
flighted a bit more, tapped square
oof, the beast has awoken, Morkel jams the bat handle with a snorting bumper, Marsh doing well to keep it down
short and at the body this time, jabbed to the leg side
now goes fuller, 137kph on middle and off, SMarsh squeezes it out off the inside edge
good-length ball on off, MMarsh shows it a straight bat
ooh, close to sneaking through, manages to get the bat in the way defending on off again
shorter in the channel and left alone
round the wicket, tossed up on middle and leg, defended
SMarsh comes down and works back past the bowler
floated up nice and slow, 'ooohs' and 'aaahs' around the bat as MMarsh jabs at the ball
straighter line, this skids on as Mitch plays back, gets his bat down in time
lobbed up around off stump, pushed sway
quicker, going on with the arm as MMarsh drops back and punches towards point
in the channel, slightly back of a length, SMarsh leaves it be
fuller, 136kph and punched into the off side

klang! Short and fiery and SMarsh takes the blow on the helmet! Was through the pull early, from the looks of it, the ball cannoning into the peak and grille, which combine to do their job and leave the batsman unscathed
back of a length in the channel, lets this one go
length ball, sliding in and blocked towards cover
good length, Mitch plants the front foot and steers into the off side
oh, top shot! Driven with precision, Shaunie boy skipping down and lacing the ball through extra cover
flighted, spinning in to the hit the pads as he tries to work to leg
uses the feet and defends this time
tossed up, again he meets it advancing down the pitch, played back to Maharaj
tossed up and pushed into the covers
spanked for four more, this time back down the ground! Skipping out to attack again and he lashes it past Maharaj's despairing dive to long-on
testing line, rising in the channel and it draws the outside edge - but flies low past gully for four!
oof, beats the bat, excellent line and MMarsh is nearly caught fiddling
good length around off, pushed into the covers
presses out and defend
eep, this skids on a touch low, 141kph and thundering into the bottom of the bat as Marsh jumps back on off

speared into the pads, fast and furious... but the appeal dies in his throat! Heading down leg, I think, Dharmasena unmoved again, Rabada troubling Mitchell as he had done his brother. Just clipping leg stump, according to Hawk-Eye
round the wicket, tossed up on leg and tapped away
flat trajectory, SMarsh starts in the crease and pushes to midwicket
gives it some air, drifting across and clipped to mid-off without timing
flighted, a touch wider and Shaun frees the arm to blap a drive, picks out extra cover this time
goes over the wicket, looped up around off stump, SMarsh defends
and SMarsh calmly tickles the ball back to the bowler to finish a maiden over and take the players to tea
tossed onto a good length, and firmly pushed back down the pitch
round the wicket, back of a length, Mitch punches off the back foot
nudged to the leg side
tossed up on the pads, glided behind square
drilled down to mid-off
on the back foot, tucked to the leg side, a decent constrictive over
width outside off stump, no stroke offered yet as Shaun (for it is he) leaves alone
hops through to the keeper, outside off
ooh, lucky, lucky! Flung out a touch wider, SMarsh has a wild swipe and under-edges his drive just past the off stump, and away past the keeper too!
that's a good riposte. Speared in fuller and straighter, hastily squeezed back down the pitch with bat and pad together
on the hips, nudged to the leg side
outside off, and through to the keeper
turning from outside off, worked with the angle off the pads
drifting in with the arm, that's a tidy delivery, watchfully repelled
sliding down leg this time, an attempted flip off the hip as it goes by
stunning bowling! Finds the right area once again, Shaun Marsh feels for the ball, uncertain of the spin, it drifts and bounces, kisses the edge, floats to slip, and South Africa have their fifth!
looped onto a good length
firmly behind the line, punched hard back to the bowler
outside off, a hint of movement off the seam, poked through the off side
tight line, solid defence, covering everything on the back foot
full length, blocked into the covers with bat tight to the body
swing from the arm, outside off, tempting Marsh on the drive
driven hard on the up, into the covers
tight line, hint of movement, with the keeper standing up to reduce any attempt to take liberties. Blocked to cover
round the wicket, poked into the covers
squares up in defence, on the back foot.
walking down the wicket to meet another well-flighted delivery. Can't make much of that as the bowler gathers
drawn forward once more, excellent pressure from round the wicket with a man right under his nose at silly point
pushes cautiously back to the bowler once more
slightly leg-sided, and a grateful sweep to get off the mark. That'll settle the nerves
poked to cover
nip and bounce outside off stump, and Marsh definitely played at that one! Well bowled
wider line, a flamboyant leave
lured onto the front foot by an unassuming outswinger. A firm connection on the drive, but short cover snaffles well with a tumble
stabbed out to cover with bat and pad tight together
nibble off the pitch on a very full length, firmly defended back whence it came
tapped to cover
tossed up on middle and leg, eased back to the bowler
advances down the track and nearly over-runs it as he's forced to dig down late
into the covers once more
worked to midwicket, this is probing and unrelenting stuff
very solid in defence once more, high elbow and patted back down the pitch
on the back foot, and crunched to point. Good contact as Philander dropped a touch short, but can't get it away
eased to the leg side, a fine tumbling stop to keep the tourniquet tight
finally, a boundary for Paine and a nicely snaffled one too, opening the face as Philander offers just enough width from back of a length, Firmly through third man
full length, left alone, and that is agonisingly tight as Paine reads the swing well and leaves his stumps unguarded
worked out to cover once more
opens the face in an attempt to work a single to backward point
round the wicket, short and wide, stand and deliver. Dumped through the covers with non-existent footwork. Lovely biffing
much better, fuller length, a touch quicker too, aiming directly at the stumps, and blocked
Markram at short cover intercepts expertly with one hand as Marsh drives
poked to the off side
on the back foot, anchored in the crease, fended to cover
pushed to the off side
tight wicket to wicket line
bending away from the right-hander
big outswinger, no stroke offered
wider on the crease, angled into the stumps on a very full length, Paine forced onto the defensive once again
wicket to wicket, bending through the air, solid in defence
well bowled! Big nip outside off, really steep bounce from a good length, and de Kock does as well to gather cleanly as Paine does to avoid nicking it
back of a length, slashed through the off side
full and straight, defended on the front foot back to the bowler
leaning forward, very watchful as Maharaj turns the screw
well played! Admirable patience, allied to an ability to make the rare opportunity count. A fraction too wide, and bashed fiercely through point
back onto the straight and narrow, head over the ball to block
middle and leg line, tucked to mid-on
wide on the crease, angling in, and defended in a flurry of limbs back down the pitch
banged in short, deflected round the corner
onto the front foot, a firm connection on the drive, but short cover is well positioned to intercept
back of a length, tailing into the right hander, pumped back up the pitch
left alone on a good length, the keeper gathers as the ball carries through nicely
wide line, almost too wide, but Test match rules apply. No stroke offered
forward and neatly pouched at short cover
an open-faced waft into the covers, beats the diving fielder, but not before he's got a very solid hand on it. Good half-stop
flicked into the leg side
lots of air, tossed right up and dipping late. Punched firmly back past the bowler
flipped into the leg side
round the wicket, very full length, punched into the covers
bashing out a good length, outside off stump. No stroke considered on this occasion
short and hauled into the leg side, not quite timed but it'll suffice
tight line on off stump, angling in to the stumps, and drawing a squared-up defensive push back to the bowler
left alone outside off, too wide to tempt a stroke
short, and another well-connected pull out to deep midwicket. Not over-hitting the stroke, just lining up the ball and placing it out into the deep
a yawning leave outside off stump
low full toss, wellied on the up ... inches short of mid-on! Good grief, that would have been a tame dismissal
another full toss, another near-miss! Dipping late, into the drive, and slapped airily, just out of the reach of short cover! Yikes
punched back down the pitch, to the bowler himself this time
loopy full length, dipping under the eyeline and tapped back down the pitch
wider line, a gliding cut to backward point
through to the keeper with minimum fuss. A bit of an all-sorts over, nearly scrounging the breakthrough. But SA are one over closer to that new ball...
dabbed out to point, the lights are blinking into life now
probing line and length, nudged to gully
very full, skewed back down the pitch with a bit of a leading edge, but wide of the bowler
lovely lift from a good length, Marsh is tempted by the wider line but has to remove his bat from harm's way sharpish
on the toes, that's an easy pick-up, over the leg side and away to the rope. Too full, and Marsh needed only to connect to score
shoulders arms again to a fuller length outside off
solid defence, drawn onto the front foot by a full straight delivery
stands tall on the back foot, pushed back to the bowler
outside off, biffed with lots of bottom hand to short cover
back of a length, tight line, chopped through third man with an open face
short and innocuous. Marsh climbs into an eager pull but scuffs his shot to midwicket
fuller length, tapped to cover
solidly onto the front foot
width and cracked through the covers. That's some lovely timing
this nips back a little, good line in the channel and Marsh chops down on it in defence
back of a length, 137kph around off, hops into line
climbing through in the corridor, wide enough for Marsh to ignore
props forward to defend a length delivery
shortish in the channel, Paine gets across to defend
comes across and works to the leg side
in the channel, zipping through as Paine shoulders arms
angled in but it's too straight, 137kph and flicked fine, the ball races away to the rope for four
length ball in the channel, up above 140kph but Paine ushers it through
sprayed down the leg side, this leaves de Kock in the dirt, groping for the ball as a wayward full-bunger scuttles away for byes
tossed up and pushed back down the track
flat outside off and Marsh unleashes Mjolnir, hammering a beefy cut behind point for four
flighted, a touch straighter and the ball hits the inside edge
presses forward and taps back to the bowler
looped up wide of the stumps and Marsh pokes towards point
flighted, nice and slow and defended coming forwards
a decent sighter, straight through to the keeper
keeps a touch low outside off stump, no stroke once more

a hint of reverse swing as the ball tails in towards the off stump and Paine pokes a firm jab into the covers. He sets off for a quick single, but Marsh is a touch more sluggish. The shy goes to the wrong end though
tight line, good lift. Marsh lifts his gloves high
a hint of late outswing on a wider line, no stroke once again. Keeps a touch lower this time
tails in again as Marsh adjusts late to defend into the leg side. A tidy first over with just a bit of threat
round the wicket, good tight line and length, pushed into the covers
patted back down the pitch for the bowler to collect
static feet and an angled bat, prodded to point
a bigger stride down the pitch, taps a defensive push around the front pad, into the leg side
looped up, calmly driven to short cover
worked into the leg side
big reverse swing from Rabada, howling into the toes and well dug out on a yorker length. Interesting signs
short and sharp, good morning Mr Paine. He snaps his head out of the line as the ball whistles through to the keeper
a loose slash as the ball nips the other way this time, keeps low outside off
wider line, not a lot of lift off the deck as Paine shapes to cut then leaves alone
another urgent waft of the bat, chasing the outswinger and avoiding a graze through to the keeper
big inswinger again, he's making this ball talk this morning. Paine is equal to the task this time, poking a softed hand block back to the bowler
head over the ball, punched into the covers
sharp turn from a middle and leg line, tapped with an angled bat down through third man
wheeling away, looped up into the toes and threatening to turn. Played with respect into the off side
clipped calmly to mid-on
full face of the bat, pushing the ball back to the bowler, with a slip and short leg in attendance
clipped into the leg side but can't beat the field
a hint of reverse, tailing into Marsh who eases it into the covers
width, and a touch of movement back into the bat. Marsh flings a cut at thin air
good angle and areas, coming back into the bat once again. Firmly stabbed into the off side
fuller length on a wider line, Marsh commits himself to the square drive, but point intercepts
on the pads, and gloved in the air into the leg side. A leg gully would have guzzled that
a big outswinger, beats a loose waft
very full, outswing straightaway, cautiously blocked to cover
back of a length, just outside off stump, tapped into the covers
good probing stuff from Philander, with the keeper standing up already. Curling from an off-stump line, into the keeper's gloves
hurried by a fuller straighter ball, just about closes the gate on his defensive block
nudged to point and they gallop an instant single
drilled on the up, into the covers
punched back to the bowler
sharper pace, through to the keeper, good nip off the deck and beats a wafty back-foot punch
attempted pull, but the ball is onto the bat too quickly. Thuds into the thigh pad

edged and gone! Perfect new-ball bowling from Rabada, ideal line and length, pace and lift off the deck, drawing the stroke, finding the edge with just a hint of away movement, and de Kock snaffles the chance
very tight line to welcome the new man, just outside off and misses the stump by a whisker!
right behind the line this time to fend the ball back to the bowler, and that's a wicket maiden for Rabada
tight wicket-to-wicket line, Marsh plays for the outswing but this one wobbles straight on, inside-edged to square leg
forward with an angled bat, pushed into the covers
full once again, nothing to attack whatsoever. Channelling the Brian Statham 'you miss I hit' mentality
wider line, good lift off the deck, through to the keeper
left alone again, probing line outside off
angles into the stumps, a very tight leave from Marsh but well judged in the end
aggressive line and length, angling into the stumps, squeezed to point off the back foot
short and vicious! Cummins ducks, but the ball follows him into the arm-pit and deflects away through fine leg. Cummins will remember that one...
full and straight, a big appeal, but that one is just shaping down leg
full and straight, right behind the line
a bit of a loose one, a full toss fired down the leg side, and de Kock does well to get a glove on that
angled into the pads, looking for the magic ball, but a deflection behind square gets Cummins up the other end
lifting through to the keeper
full-length outswinger, watched onto the bat and pushed to cover
tight wicket-to-wicket bowling, firmly blocked on off stump
angled across the right-hander, no stroke this time as the keeper gathers
firmly forward, and defended back down the pitch
hopping over the top of off stump as Cummins leaves on length. Tight stuff
sharp pace but misdirected, fizzing down the leg side
fuller length, driven hard back towards Rabada's shins, and that is a dropped catch! It came at him hard, but Rabada couldn't wrap his fingers round the ball
angled down the leg side, flicks the pad on the way through
attempted yorker, speared into the toes but clipped uppishly into the leg side
wider line outside off, keeps a touch low as Marsh shoulders arms
onto the front foot, pushed to the off side
good lift from just outside off stump, no stroke offered
tailing into the right-hander, drawing the batsman forward to cover his stumps with determination
outside off, Philander shifts his line half a stump's width wider, but Cummins' judgement is spot on as he lets this one go
head over the ball, firmly driven to mid-off
short and targetting the helmet, Cummins sways inside the line as the ball hops through to the keeper on the bounce
left alone, absolutely nothing on offer for Australia to cash in on. Excellent bowling
good line to start, dabbed into the covers
fizzing down the leg side, Marsh attempts a pull but can't make contact
wafted off the pads to backward square
short. Cummins ducks. Keeper gathers
angled into the pads once again, and Cummins gets off the mark with a well placed clip behind square. Morkel hasn't quite found his length yet
outside off, left alone once again
Vernon whirs in and puts the ball on a length, it buzzes back like an angry bee, Cummins swats it down
sliding down the leg side, swish and a miss
good length, bustling 130kph around off stump, Cummins gets into line
angled a touch straighter and Cummins squeezes the ball to midwicket
perfect line in the channel, just needed to be a touch fuller... well watched and left alone
another teasing length ball on fourth/fifth stump, Cummins throws his hands up and lets it go
back of a length outside off and Marsh dabs it square for one
whoosh, that's not far from the poles! Morkel brings it back off a length, but Cummins knows the bounce from that height is always likely to take the ball over and shoulders arms confidently
touch short, 134kph outside off, nibbling back in but again there's no stroke
pushed a little straighter and Cummins brings the bat down to block this time
round the wicket, banged in short but it climbs through above the batsman as he ducks
short again, 132kph but again the ball passes safely through without causing Cummins any discomfort
full, draws Marsh forward and into the drive, pinged firmly to the right of mid-off but the dive cuts it off
probing line, straightening a fraction on off stump, tapped back to the bowler
length delivery, 129kph and curling like the smoke off a freshly lit cheroot, blocked again
fuller, driven again, not middled and mid-off comes across to collect
good length and holding its line in the channel, defended towards extra cover
comes across and blocks a length ball in front of square
round the wicket, pushed through outside off and left alone
floated up a touch slower, Cummins presses out to defend, gets a thick inside edge into this pad
tossed up, defended coming forwards again
plays back, tucked to the leg side

bowled 'im, mind the gap! After the praise, the fall... Cummins pressed forwards but was feeling for the ball, bat in front of pad and there was room enough for the hard nut to skid on through without turning as much as expected, rattling the timbers. Third scalp for Maharaj
over the wicket, tossed up up outside off, blocked coming forwards
steps across and defends into the covers
dug in halfway down, skipping on as Marsh pulls, comes off the splice in front of square for one

length ball, Starc plays an expansive shot on the up, thick-edged past the closer catcher and Maharaj has to five chase from square leg, he then slips over as he approaches the boundary and can't stop the ball trundling for four
rising from a length, defended into the off side

woof, prancing ball, takes the gloves - but clears slip and runs away for four! Starc was both trying to get his hands up and avoid playing the ball, ended up punching it clear of the leaping Amla at second slip
another boundary, this one stroked through extra cover with the grace of Gower! Pitched up by Morkel and Starc leans on a drive, all timing to the rope
flighted, whumped back at the bowler, who gets a finger on it but can't prevent a run
tossed up and defended towards cover
oh, so close, didn't quite carry to short leg! The ball flew off the inside edge but was just short, I think, zipped under the hands
tossed up and worked for one
touch short outside off, Marsh drops back and cracks a cut through the infield
four more, Starc is wielding the willow like a light sabre, plants the front foot and clatters a sweep away to deep square leg
Marsh comes across and pushes watchfully into the off side

pitched up and lashed for four! Brutal power, in front of the man in the deep, that is a half-century for Marsh, who has played very well again, continuing his form after being recalled during the Ashes
gets a bit too straight and Marsh flicks the single off his pads

banged in, Starc takes another blow on the glove, this time clears short leg! It got big on him as he closed the bat face, think it hit the shoulder of the bat then jammed into his bottom hand - he shakes it off at the non-striker's end
another bumper, Marsh wear it on the body... Tough man, that came out at 139kph
touch short and zipping in to hit the body as Marsh hangs back
tossed up and nurdled to leg for one
flat outside off, Marsh rocks on to the back foot and cuts in front of square
quicker ball, spinning down the leg side, into the gloves as Starc stays back

WALLOP! Tossed up full, Starc is down on one knee and carts the ball on to the grass banks at deep midwicket, a disdainful slog-sweep - one of his favourite shots - and it came right out of the screws
comes across and taps the ball away
pushed through, defended on the back foot
short of a length and defended to the off side
Marsh comes across his stumps and dabs down square
back of a length in the channel, Marsh gets out of the way
pitched up, 135kph and blocked firmly into the covers coming forwards
length, pushed into the off side again
dug in short, Marsh stays back and pulls a single through backward square
floated up from round the wicket, straightening a touch as Marsh presses forward and runs the ball behind point
prodded into a gap on the front foot
over the wicket to Starc, flighted on off and blocked
bosh, more humpty from Starcy! Out comes the meaty swing to leg, heaved high over the rope at deep midwicket again!
goes round the wicket, bit of grip on off as Starc punches back down the ground, mid-off can't quite get there and they get a couple
flat on leg stump, clipped fine for a single
fired across the bows, Starc stands tall and punches one more in front of point
short of a length around off, 140kph and Marsh blocks back down the pitch
round the wicket, Morkel trying the bodyline attack again, Marsh ducks a bumper
short, 138kph and rising towards the ribs, blocked from back in the crease
dug in, on the stumps, Marsh stays back and defends
oof, that was nasty, rearing at the face as Marsh hung back, did well to jab it away behind square for a single
zing, he's on the mark straight away! Touch short but the ball swerved devilishly as Marsh felt for it, beaten outside off
fired in straighter, 138kph and squirted out through midwicket for one
round the wicket, short and flying through a couple of feet outside off, 142kph but left alone
angled in on the stumps, Starc blocks it firmly towards mid-on
back of a length, Starc reaches away from his body, thick-edges to gully on the bounce
yikes, nearly gets him, Rabada gives it some licks and the ball zips past the edge as Starc hangs his bat out in the channel
tossed up on off, prodded back to the bowler
sliding on a little quicker outside off, opens the face and runs to backward point
pushed through flat and Marsh tickles it into a gap in the covers - up comes the Australia 300

gottim, Maharaj removes his tormentor! Tossed up and spinning in to flatten off stump, think Starc has just misread the line there... So that ends a lively stand of 49, Starc thrashing the majority of them, and again SA take a wicket with the last ball before lunch
stabbed off the pads, into the leg side
forward and defended to midwicket
hustling pace, on the back foot, deflected uneasily into the leg side
width outside off stump, no great carry as de Kock scoops up on the second bounce
tremendous timing! A full length outswinger, not a bad ball at all, but Marsh lines it up, presents the full face, and eases a drive straight back past the bowler
another pleasingly solid connection, this time a punch into the covers
oh, well bowled, nibble off the seam from just back of a length, Lyon comes half-forward, but is nowhere near the ball as it jags away
and this one swings in sharply to rap the pad
outswinger on a good length, swiped into the covers
tight line, in the channel, left alone with a waft of the bat
on the back foot, and nudged into the leg side
short, wide, smashed straight through de Villiers' grasp at gully! He is standing very close, due to Philander's lack of pace, but that was technically a drop
slapped into the covers for another single
sliding into the pads, a big inswinger, but misdirected
banged in short, fenced down into the crease, right on top of the bounce with a well-timed hop
full face of the bat, walking into a defensive push for added emphasis
back of a length, pushed on the up into the off side
Big hooping inswinger, sliding into the toes and chiselled away. Lots of movement in the offing, but not got the line yet
width, dabbed down through third man with an open face. Cheeky runs, and he keeps marching on
very full, speared into the toes, punched into the covers
banged in short, an uncharacteristic long hop, and Marsh leans back to slap a cut/drive through the covers
fully forward to meet the fuller length, head over the ball, guarding the outswinger
forward and defended into the off side
poked to short cover
back of a length once more, but a tighter line. Another flashing uppercut into the off side
pushed onto the back foot, defended into the leg side
too short, not horrifically, but Marsh's footwork is swift and decisive, leaning back and smashing a lofted pull over the leg side
leaning forward and defended into the off side
punched to short cover once more
head over the ball, and pushed back down the pitch
turning from leg to off, worked with the spin out to point
chopped hard out to point
a touch of width, another flowing flash outside off stump
big outside edge! It sounds for a moment as though Lyon has been bowled through the gate, but turns out de Kock can't gather behind the stumps... another half-chance
solidly forward to defend
big leave outside off stump, and no stroke offered
inducker on a good length, firmly pressed to point with bat and pad tight together
rising onto the toes to fence another drive into the covers. This is getting frustrating for South Africa, who can scent the end of the innings...
good flight, extra bounce from a fuller length, Marsh lines up another slap but misses out
more circumspectly onto the front foot to push to the leg side

well bowled, but unlucky... tossed up, looping into the toes, and a nutmeg of an inside-edge flies through Marsh's legs down to fine leg, where Philander makes a meal of his boundary fielding, but just about saves the four. He's into the 90s...
worked back down the pitch, into the gap at mid-on
defended on the back foot
fenced to short leg
fenced through third man... they all count, especially in the 90s!

goes for glory, and holes out to mid-on! Oh Mitch... a length delivery, his eyes lit up, a big heave through the line, but he found the tallest man on the field. Morne Morkel reaches out to snaffle the chance, and Australia's linchpin has to depart
pushed back onto the stumps to defend
clobbered off the back foot, into the covers
attempted yorker, well watched and squeezed into the leg side
short and wide, but Hazelwood's languid drive is easily intercepted at short cover
round the wicket, looped onto the legs. Pushed to the on side
that's a pleasing wallop from Lyon, down on one knee, scything a slog sweep clean across the line
swept again, and up comes the 350 with another finely connected biff. In front of square this time
that's the way to do it. Lyon attempted another mow, this time down the ground, but a big miscue loops calmly into the covers, for Maharaj to claim a richly deserved five-wicket haul!
very full, very straight to launch the innings. A hint of shape towards the cordon as Elgar eases forward to defend
outside off, full length again, as this one jags off the seam to the keeper
probing line and length, in the channel outside off, Elgar declines to play a stroke
on the pads, and clipped sweetly behind square. That's the shot he's been waiting for. First contact of the innings and it's a boundary
very full and straight, tailing from middle to off. Solidly blocked
good carry from wide of off stump, an energetic leave to finish the over
sliding down the leg side
back of a length, outside off stump, attempted drive but not timed
swinging down the leg side once again, Hazlewood just feeling his way into the spell
leaning forward to block back down the pitch
better line from Hazlewood, outside off and angling in. Markram leans forward to block
inswinger, played from deep in the crease and worked into the leg side
squeezed into the leg side, they look for the quick single and pick it up with ease
snorter! The right-handed Markram has no answer to one that bursts off the deck on a middle and leg line, holds its line and zooms across his bows to beat the outside edge
tapped into the covers, that's a sensible single, see off the new ball from the non-striker's end
defensive prod into the off side
nip and bounce from a good length, Elgar wears this one in the midriff, and nearly knocks the ball onto his stumps in the process! Another medal for the old campaigner
leans inside the line to let this one go past his nose
a crunching drive through the covers! That's a lovely way to settle into his innings, marginally over-pitched, and pounded through the line
tailing in a touch and nurdled with the angle into the leg side
stands tall on the back foot to block back down the pitch
another sweet strike into the covers, not timed on this occasion, but a good stride to meet the ball and placed well into the gap
poked energetically into the covers, leaning onto the front foot and calling quickly
better length to finish the over, angled into the right-hander who blocks with good intent
pitched up and Elgar leans out to tip and run into the covers, tight single but they run it well
touch back of a length, over middle and off and tapped down defensively
fuller, draws Markram fowards but he gets the ball away nicely once again, a controlled push-drive and it scuttles away to the rope at deep extra cover
back of a length, 146kph but wide and left alone
short again, Markram slugs merrily and gets a thick outside edge over the cordon for four more! Bit wild and woolly but it only adds to Starc's frustrations
switches to round the wicket, defended solidly on off
back of a length and defended coming across
Hazlewood is bowling round the wicket, good length outside off, 141kph and Elgar crabs forward to block
slightly short in the channel, watches it all the way through to the keeper
dug in short, outside the line of off and Elgar ducks the challenge
now then, that's a searching delivery, touch short and wide but Elgar is still drawn into playing, 140-plus kays and it whistles past the bat
presses forward and blocks into the covers
banged in back of a length around off stump, 144kph and Markram gets in behind it

pitched up but it's in the slot and Markram has shown he likes a drive in the sunshine, top down and with the breeze in his hair... Lovely flowing punch through the covers and it skips to the rope once again
better line and length from Starc, defended square
pitched up around off stump, blocked on the front foot
shortish, played from the crease
dug in again, good pace from Starc but Markram is seeing it well and lines up another doughty block
floated up outside off, Elgar leans out and lets it go

oh, brilliant from Lyon, a full-length diving catch off his own bowling - Elgar is a goner! The GOAT is amongst 'em, kicking open the door with the new ball! We knew there was turn in this surface and Lyon locates a tricky spot straight away, gets the ball to straighten from round the wicket and Elgar's leading edge spooned back towards the bowler, who swoops to his right to grab a low catch with both hands
over the wicket, tossed up and spinning in as Amla comes across
significant turn here, tucked down towards short leg on the bounce

another one goes, two in the over for Lyon! Squeezed to short leg via bat and pad, Bancroft snaps up the chance! Huge wicket, the eternal Amla lasts just three deliveries... Lyon was on the money straight away, never mind the change in angle of attack, and Amla didn't look comfy; he lunged forward as the ball gripped and turned, hit the splice and then presented a straightforward catch to the man under the helmet
looped up and turning in on the stumps, safely defused to finish a magnificent first over from Lyon - a double-wicket maiden with the new ball!
comes across to defend on off
shortish around off stump and Markram jumps into line
angled in towards the stumps, blocked to the on side
probing line, 140kph on a good length, Markram bows his head over a forward defensive
length ball, climbing sharply in the channel as he gets his hands out of the way
tap-tapping away in the corridor, just back of a length, Markram pretends there's no one at home
tossed up and de Villiers dances down, whips the ball wide of mid-on, and immediately makes his mark with a boundary
flighted, again AB steps out and works a single to leg
floated up around off stump, Markram drills the ball back to the bowler on the bounce
shouts of excitement from around the bat as Markram defends down towards short leg
flighted, spinning in and jabbed into the turf past the lurking Bancroft
length delivery, angling in on the stumps and defended to leg
good gas, 139kph outside off, left alone as it flies through to the keeper
pitched up and de Villiers unleashes a crisp drive, sends the ball bouncing into the stumps at the non-striker's end
fired in from wide on the crease, hits the outer half of the bat and runs square
short of a length, 139kph over the top of the stumps, blocked
full outside off, 142kph and drilled to cover this time - maiden, but not for want of trying on de Villiers' part
flighted, turning in from outside off, tapped down safely
here comes Markram now, strolls down the pitch and hits over the top, not the cleanest of connections but it clears mid-on
ooh, that bounced a bit more, hits the splice as he props forward
flatter outside off, poked square from the crease
goes back this time, blocked resolutely in front of the stumps
fizzing down on off stump, Markram shows it the maker's name in defence
banged in and collared on the pull, de Villiers slams four over square leg, brushes the dirt off his shoulder
pitched up, arrowing in on off stump, stifled appeal from Hazlewood as he defends with bat next to pad... Think he was probably outside the line
back of a length around off stump, thudding into the splice of the bat
fired in straight, 145kph/90mph over middle and off, tucked down to the on side
short outside off, lets this one go
good length, that's where he wants to be, 142kph and threatening to come back in... but not enough to make AB play as he sticks out the front pad and shoulders arms
flighted, appreciable turn from off to leg, stabbed down past the catcher
pushed through on the stumps and again Markram blocks from the crease
floated up, a juicy full delivery outside off and Markram plucks it, steps out to cream a cover drive for four
puts a bit more pace on this, flatter and blocked on the front foot
looped up, spinning towards middle and leg, jabbed down
flighted outside off, nice revs as it dips and spins but the line was wide enough for Markram not to play
glides in, economical wind-up, hits back of a length around off, AB defends
angled in on the stumps, 141kph and tapped down towards mid-on
back of a length and worked to leg as de Villiers comes across once again
tight lines, tight D
pitched up a bit more and de Villiers steps out to twock a drive to cover
shortish, 141kph, goes back and across and steers the ball square
nicely bowled, spinning in on the stumps, Markram blocks
tossed up and defended diligently
lots of overspin as Markram stays back and fends the ball away to the on side
flighted, uses the feet to get to the pitch, defended back to the bowler
full and flighted, blocked on the front foot
pushed through on off, more steadfast defence from Markram
Cummins thrums away around the line of off, pushed to mid-off
shortish on off, defended
lovely shot, slightly overpitched and de Villiers sends a rasping drive back past the stumps for four
banged in short, de Villiers had moved across but drops his hands and leaves
slightly short, 144kph and blocked on off stump
banged in, that's a tricky bumper to deal with but ABdV rides it well
tossed up and driven, slightly uppishly back through mid-on, rotating the strike and raising the South Africa 50 in the process
shouts of excitement from around the bat as de Villiers plays with the spin and glances one fine
tossed up on off, punched down the ground
flighted, AB comes across to defend
uses the feet and clips another single into the leg side
gives it some air, Markram gets into line and defends on off
banged in and tucked of the hip
back of a length, 144kph around middle and leg stump, defended down into the on side
short, climbing up outside off, Markram rides the bounce and keeps the ball down
back of a length, 139kph but played neatly off the back foot, just a checked push through cover but it zips away for couple

fended to short leg - Cummins strikes! Easy as you like, banged in at the body and Markram simply pops another catch to Bancroft. A lapse in concentration from Markram? He seemed to be playing the short stuff okay until then... And that will be tea, with another wicket falling on the brink of an interval
banged in short, and pulled backward of square
big stride forward, pushed into the off side
well flighted on off stump, worked around the front pad to short leg
stretching onto the front foot to block
nudged with the turn into the leg side
aiming to work the ball to leg at all times, front foot to the pitch
squared up on off stump, threatening line and length
striding forward, head over the ball, meeting a rapid off-stump delivery with a straight bat
full and threatening again, attacking the off stump and fenced to the off side
width outside off stump, no stroke offered
sharp bouncer and Faf is entirely in control of his swatted pull! Lands short of fine leg, but that was good aggression from Cummins
de Villiers follows suit as Cummins bangs it in short once again. Fine leg in business once again as he rolls his wrists on the shot
much fuller, flicked into the leg side with a waft of the wrists
sharp turn! Lyon tosses it up, lets it grip outside off, and it thuds into the pad. But safely outside the line on that occasion
good riposte. A combative sweep, picking the length early and hauling it behind square
watchfully blocked, into the leg side with a perfectly perpendicular bat
turning again, short leg is in attendance, and gathers off the face of the bat
another big ripper! Beats the inside edge, but Faf is well lined up outside off as his pad is thwacked again
more calmly blocked back down the pitch. But Lyon is probing away
full length, drilled firmly into the gap in the covers
right behind the line to defend
on the hip, a flick of the wrists out towards square leg, but short leg's shin fields well
angled bat, into the off side
worked down the ground with a firm punch. Paused for a moment to ensure the ball was past the bowler, but they safely make it for the single
superb yorker! Attacking the base of off with late outswing, but that was watched all the way onto the toe of the bat
stretching forward to defend
a crunching sweep, planting the foot outside the line of off, and flinging his hands across the line. Nailed it
well bowled again, 'gorgeous Nathan!' is the call from behind the stumps. And who am I to argue?
forward and blocked to the leg side
back of a length, plays for turn but this one drifts straight on. A fat outside edge squirts to gully
looped up, a bit of drift, ever threatening. Defended to mid-on
pushed onto the back foot, blocked back down the pitch
head over the ball, worked down to mid-on
pops from back of a length and had there been a leg gully, that would have been guzzled! Right at the body, and awkwardly fended off
short again, and this time de Villiers has no qualms about throwing the kitchen sink at it. Utterly panned over the leg side!
short and leg sided, no need to play at that one
back of a length, nudged into the leg side
tossed up and driven, firmly through the covers. Such quick hands, picking off the fractional over-pitch. Sublime
nudged into the leg side, down the ground, and they jog through
now then, South Africa are on the march after lunch, as Faf this time is the one to take the initiative, advancing down the track to loft a mighty clip onto the grass banks at wide long-on
back of a length, from round the wicket, chopped to point. Three close catchers still in attendance
blocked into the off side
wider outside off from over the wicket again, a bit of grip as it is fended away off the back foot
full and straight, tapped back to the bowler
probing line and length outside off stump. Left alone
striding onto the front foot, closing the door on another full, straight delivery
wider on the crease, angling into the stumps, but the same result from AB, full face of the bat in defence, head over the ball
well judged leave, very tight to off,  but AB is in a good place in this innings...
sumptuous. A fraction too full, in the arc for the drive, and mown through the covers
width outside off, and left alone

perfect from Starc! Around the wicket, wider on the crease, straightens it off the pitch. Du Plessis is committed on the front foot, defending the angle back into his stumps, and grazes an edge to Paine!
another threatening ball to welcome the new batsman, hitting the seam and beating the edge outside off
through to the keeper once more, tormenting the edge as it goes by
left alone, slightly wider line this time and gratefully ignored
pushed onto the back foot, blocked in front of off
full length, bending in towards middle and leg, and blocked to the leg side
angling into the right hander, big stride in defence to press the ball back down the pitch
left alone outside off
firmly punched into the off side. Mid-off swoops to intercept
short and sharp, but de Bruyn watches carefully and sways inside the line
left alone with bat held high. Kept low through to the keeper too
through to the keeper, no stroke offered
round the wicket, wider line, de Villiers leaves well alone
full length, very straight bat, and pinballed straight back down the ground, placing the bat in the line and letting the timing do the rest
round the wicket, hauls the bat out of harm's way as the ball fizzes through
firmly into line to defend
full length again, and not quite timed this time as the ball pings into the covers off the toe of the bat. Safe enough
nurdled into the leg side as the ball pops up into his hip, and de Bruyn is off the mark
firmly into line
through to the keeper
short, and slap-pulled out to deep square leg, where it is gathered with a slide. Always in control of the stroke
sliding down the leg side. Hazlewood hasn't quite nailed that dogged line and length so far
tailing into the right hander, who stands tall to defend on the back foot
round the wicket, such a nagging line and length, reversing back into the right hander with a constant threat of seam movement. Blocked this time
outside off, and left alone
no stroke offered as Starc strays wider
such sweet timing! Inswinger, fractionally too straight, but what a riposte from de Villiers, punching with perfect timind through midwicket
another firm strike, this time into the covers. He's middling everything
nudged off the hip to square leg
sliding down the leg side. Not quite on it at the moment
better line and length, outside off and bouncing through to the keeper
wider on the crease, piling in towards the timbers. Blocked again
sharp bouncer, but AB is onto it, flashing a pull over his shoulder and down to backward square
sharp bounce, into the ribs, and that is gloved inches wide of the stretching Paine behind the stumps! So nearly...
nudged to the leg side
driven and gone! De Bruyn is suckered by Starc's deadly angle, into the stumps, nipping away. Stuck on the crease, he tried to hit his way out of a hole, and succeeded only in a fat edge to Paine!
full length
over the wicket, such a full length, de Kock is flat-footed as he stabs down at the crease to defend
well bowled again, wobbling on a full length, and stabbed into the leg side
more threatening late movement, back into the toes of the left hander. Blocked with caution on the crease
fully forward and squeezed into the leg side
width and cracked through point. Up comes AB's fifty and he has looked utterly supreme throughout. Such a lot resting on him making it a big one though...
tighter line, solid block
full length from wide on the crease, squeezed into the off side
better line and length now from Hazlewood, offering nothing to hit as he zeroes in on the top of off
very full and strikes the pad, but never a danger of lbw
fractionally overpitched  but for once AB can't put an attacking stroke away. A slightly mistimed biff trundles to mid-on
on the pads, and whipped away. Sweet timing and placement, and that'll help settle him into his role
over the wicket to the left-hander,  very full length and blocked back down the track
onto the front foot, pushed into the covers
line and length, probing away outside off stump
on the legs, clipped into the gap
on the pads to the right hander, worked to backward square to keep the strike
short outside off, de Villiers just opens the face and runs it to third man, easy as you like
pitched up a bit closer, tapped into the covers coming forwards
fullish, 141kph, de Villiers shows it the big fat MRF
touch shorter outside off, steered square
pitched up in the channel and de Villiers gets right out on to the front foot, shoulders arms
slightly short around the line of off, AB just closes the face and work a single through backward square leg to keep the strike
flighted, de Villiers skips down and clips through mid-on
round the wicket, another left-hander in his sights, defended
drops a touch short, de Kock latches on a raps a cut shot behind point for a boundary
angled in, QdK shows it a solid forward block
pushed through around middle and off, defensive
flat, gripping a touch but de Kock lines it up well and blocks on middle and off
shortish outside off, lets the ball fly through
angled in a touch straighter, de Villiers presses out and deflects a run off the inside half of the bat
round the wicket to Quinny, who does well to get on top of a frisky little bumper from Patty C
Cummins puts his shoulder to the wheel, hits a length around off, defended
angled in back of a length, 138kph and turned down towards midwicket
bit of width and it's lashed through the covers, de Kock moves into double-figures
AB gets on to the front foot and pushes back to the bowler
tossed up and stroked through the off side, eased away through the infield for a couple
steps out early but Lyon spots him, fires the ball through with a lower arm and AB defends
ooh, a slight misjudgment, I think, worked the ball short of midwicket on the bounce
floated up wide of the stumps, de Villiers slaps the ball to cover
this spits and bounces as ABdV plays back, manages to keep it down
drops back in the crease and slices one past point
over the wicket, pitched up and tickled towards mid-off half forward
ooh, the timing on that, checked back towards the bowler and although Cummins gets a toe on it the ball just keeps picking up speed
comes across and taps the ball into the off side
angled in at the body and worked away to the leg side
four more for de Kock, who watches the ball sit up and beg before rattling a pull through midwicket!
floated up outside off stump and AB goes down to sweep, hit on the boot and there's half an appeal - looked outside the line, maybe some bat too
tossed up from round the wicket, defended
pushed through, de Kock covers the line and blocks
angled in with the arm, tapped away
flighted, QdK comes across
flat on the stumps, defended standing tall
yowch, the new (old) ball introduces itself to de Villiers via a rap on the gloves! Dug in short by Cummins and AB leaps to get on top of it, takes a whack on the top hand - but he's okay to continue
gets across to defend on off
length delivery, met with a defiant straight blade
powering through in the corridor outside off, lets this one go
targeting the stumps, almost looked like it might sneak through to hit the pads before de Villiers flicked it away disdainfully to fine leg
back of a length in the channel outside off, driven through cover point for a couple, nicely controlled
flighted, outside off and de Villiers sweeps low through backward square, raises the SA 150
round the wicket, tossed up and defended on off
flatter on middle and leg, tapped away
Lyon finding his groove to the southpaw, fizzed through and blocked coming forwards
flat offbreak on off stump, de Kock smothers it
gives this a bit more air but de Kock continues to line him up well in defence
back of a length, comes across to turn to leg
short, rising up around off stump, 148kph but de Villiers just <del>licks his palm, smooths his hair, checks his reflection in the mirror</del> taps it down
hammers the ball in short, AB is across and then sways out of the way
length, 143kph in the channel, stunned into the turf towards extra cover
pushed in with the arm, whipped to leg from in front of the stumps
good-length delivery, defended coming forwards on off

and now Lyon strikes, straight through de Kock! SA nerves jangle as the sixth wicket falls - they need someone to stick around. Looked like de Kock should probably have got forward to that ball but it skidded on past the bat as he camped in the crease, before applying the fatal kiss to the top of off stump
over the wicket, tossed up and blocked
Philander presses on to the front foot and stabs the ball away
floated up and blocked coming forwards again
angled in, worked away to leg off the back foot
comes across and tucks the ball to leg
short of a length, blocked on off stump
comes across and pokes through the covers, picks the gap and they come back for two
bumper from Cummins, testing the No. 8's mettle, Philander ducks
back of a length, 140kph, defended with a straight bat
good length around fourth stump, Philander prods it away towards cover
round the wicket, dug in at 140kph, how's the ticker, Vern...? Just fine, thanks: he rocks back and swats a pull for one to deep square leg
flighted, dipping around off stump, punched to mid-off
floated up and blocked on off
goes back this time and works with the spin
ooh, that's a juicy cover drive, tossed up invitingly and Philander eases out to crunch the ball for four
pushed through flatter, steered square
looped up, Philander drops into the crease and blocks
fullish length, 140kph to start off with, dinked back towards mid-on without timing
testing line, whirring back late in the channel, judged pretty well as he sticks out the front pad and watches it by
good length, 145kph/90mph a foot outside off, left alone again
pitched up and tailing in - maybe a touch of reverse for Hazlewood? - punched back to the bowler as he comes across
tight on off stump, defended again
full length in the channel, scoots through a touch low as de Villiers shoulders arms
oof, Philander reaches for the drive, edged short of second slip! Was a skimmer, never quite carrying

in the channel, Philander props forward and is beaten... Hang on, Australia are reviewing? There was barely an appeal but Smith must think he heard something. Ultra Edge is equally baffled, though, nothing on the reading, so Australia will lose a review

no doubt this time, that's a jaffa! Full and straight, demanding a stroke, then fishtailing away at the last moment to snick the edge with Philander off balance and groping for the ball! Fiendish, rapid and reversing - though Philander didn't help himself by trying to play through mid-on. Not dissimilar to the Vince ball from the Ashes, without the spectacular stump flattening (or the aid of a crack)
pitched up on off, bunted away
goes for the stump-rattling reverse-swinger again, there's half an appeal as Maharaj blocks - think bat struck pad before intercepting the ball
oof, this zips through past the edge as he hangs back and wafts outside off
shortish and worked off the hip for one - no protecting the tail here
length ball, rising up as Maharaj jumps into line and blocks

timbeeeeeeeeeeeeerrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr! Hazlewood plucks out off stump! Australia are running amok, Maharaj completely kippered by a heat-seaking delivery that demolishes his resistance, big gap between bat and pad as he hung back tentatively. Not sure AB's trust was warranted
stays over the wicket, touch short outside off and jabbed down from the crease
full and angling across, Rabada has an airy swipe that fails to connect
fired in full, Rabada clips it off his toes to midwicket and they scamper through - so he'll keep the strike. I can see this going wrong again
