over the wicket to Rabada, pitched up in the channel and driven, timed nicely for a couple

yoinks, that's stone cold! The reverse-swinging yorker crashes into Rabada's pad and, although he reviews, this is going to be curtains! Brutal delivery from Starc, not many No. 10s in the world will keep that out... So befuddled was Rabada that he must have thought he got some bat on it, but not a chance. Smashing into middle and leg
length in the channel, zips through as Morkel pokes at it

knocked 'im over! Full, fast and Morkel didn't have a hope, the ball clattering off stump via his pad! Starc screams in celebration, he wraps up a five-for with a final thunderbolt to roll South Africa over as the shadows lengthen
steams in and finds his length, swinging away but the line is wide and Cameron Bancroft can move across and leave comfortably
angling back, touch short and the ball doesn't make Bancroft play
rising from just back of a length, 136kph and left alone outside off
into the body, roughing him up and Bancroft decides to wear it, dropping the hands and taking the blow
short and climbing in the channel, 143kph but again the line is wide enough to ignore
dug in as Bancroft tries to get across, head-hunting bumper to finish the over and Bancroft has to have his wits about him to get his pineapple out of the way
pitched on a good length around middle and off, this rears up and hits the splice of the bat as Warner comes forward - variable bounce into the mix, too
tight lines, not much in the way of lateral movement yet and poked back to the bowler
slightly overpitched, 130kph on the stumps and Warner pings it back down the ground, no need to whack it, just timed out of the middle for the first runs of the innings
pushed across in the channel outside off from close to the stumps, left alone
pitched up, holding its line a fraction, tapped back to the bowler
length ball, 132kph on middle and off, Warner chops down on it in defence
length outside off, 137kph and this goes through a little low
fuller, gets Bancroft coming forward and he feels bat on ball for the first time
short and on the hip, clipped past the attendant close catcher and it races away, picks up four
banged in short and wide, again the batsman can happily ignore
Bancroft skips across and steps out to a length delivery, dabbed into a gap in the covers and they hustle the single
back of a length and pushed across the bows, 140-plus kph and Warner slices it towards point, where Markram leaps to cut it off
pitched around off stump, Bancroft gets into line
probing on a length, looking for some nibble each way, defended
teasing line, this does nip back at the right-hander as he shuffles across, nudged away from in front of the pad as Philander throws his hands up
slightly too straight, worked square off with a turn of the wrists
now, this keeps low, flicks the bottom of the bat but the ball dies in front of de Kock... looked like Bancroft was trying to withdraw at the last moment but just got a tickle on it
length ball, 135kph in the corridor of squeaky bottoms, left alone
comes across to defend around off stump
touch short and wide and Warner drops back to cut, sliced through gully for a couple
full, driven firmly as Warner steps out, well taken on the bounce by Markram in the overs
Morkel drops short, worked off the hip for a single
back of a length in the channel, zipping through as Bancroft shoulders arms
short outside off, 135kph and Bancroft attempts to cut, doesn't time the shot
length ball, snaking on leg stump, clipped in business-liked fashion off the pads and Warner bellows 'Yeah, yeah, yeah!' for the second as Morkel runs up from fine leg
good length, comes forward and taps down the track
angled across outside off stump, Warner lets it go
back of a length but it doesn't quite bounce as much as expected and Warner takes it in the midriff
sidles in and puts the ball on a length around off, 133kph and dabbed square
woof, that's the line for Big Vern, tempts Warner to have a fish and the ball skips flirtatiously past the outside edge
Morkel spears the ball in full, on target but Bancroft is alert and drops the portcullis on it
short and a touch leg side, worked away for a couple in front of square this time
climbing from back of a length, 138kph and Bancroft has to ride it, stabbed down square
dug in and jabbed away, square leg scurries after it

whipped off the pads, Maharaj has to give chase out towards deep backward square... puts in a valiant dive but replays suggest he still had the ball in his hand as the knee touched the rope, so that'll be four
fired in and Warner defends from the crease
Philander continues to probe away outside off, poked to cover
plopped on a length, 131kph but gun-barrel straight and Bancroft punches to cover
fuller, 136kph and met with conviction coming forwards
gets across and lines up another forward block
touch short, nibbling back in but flicked neatly behind square, off the inside edge but it flies fine and runs for four
back to the channel, asking the question and this time Bancroft keeps schtum, shoulders arms
and Warner goes after him first ball, tossed up and swept hard, races away to deep backward square
presses forward to block outside off
floated up full, Warner comes down and works one through mid-on
round the wicket to Bancroft, straightening on the stumps but clipped nicely through midwicket for a couple
tossed up and Bancroft comes down, not quite to the pitch but he gave it a firm smack and got it away fine of mid-off for another boundary - looking a mite more comfortable today
flatter, gripping a touch as the batsman goes back and defends
tight lines from Philander, blocked on middle and leg with bat thrust out next to pad
too straight and Warner is advancing, struck powerfully off the legs and the ball trundles away over the outfield for four more
good length, Warner showing lots of intent in both defence and attack right not, blocked to mid-off
off-stump line, not much he can do other that poke it back to the bowler
touch short, 132kph/81mph and jabbed square off the hip
miserly stuff from Philander, defended back to the bowler

pushed through, Warner's footwork is good as he moves across and then sways back to clip in front of square, there's a man at deep midwicket but they put Rabada under pressure with the call for two and he doesn't collect cleanly
tossed up and he goes for the slog-sweep, comes off the bottom edge and flies flat to midwicket
short, the ball sits up outside off and Bancroft cuts crisply to the deep point boundary
angled in from round the wicket, worked away through square leg and they push hard for two again, bringing up the Australia 50 in short order
flighted, comes down and whips to mid-on
floated up around off stump, defended
shortish to start with, width for Warner and he stabs one through point
pitched up, fourth-stump line and Bancroft prods a drive to extra cover
in the channel, rising through to the keeper as the batsman comes out and shoulders arms
pitched up, 146kph and inviting the drive, Bancroft accepts and transfers the weight forward nicely, clipped through mid-off for another boundary - lovely stroke
cranks up the pace, 150kph on off, defended
touch full, not quite there for the drive, shows it a solid block
over the wicket, pushed through and tapped to cover
flighted, spinning in and blocked late from the crease
Maharaj is aiming for the footmarks, nicely flighted and Warner tries to come forward before reverting to solid defence
tossed up and Warner attempts to paddle, flips it in the air behind square leg and they take the single
round the wicket, angled in and worked to leg
tossed up on off stump, blocked

oh, he's thrown it away! Rabada slings down a half-tracker and all Warner can do is swipe a mistimed pull to mid-on! Warner throws his head back in disgust, he did not want to do that... Slightly cramped by the angle from round the wicket, it was quick, too, but the shot was a gift. SA have their opening
off and running right away. Full and wide, swinging away, Khawaja leans into a drive and finds the gap through cover. 'Wait' followed by 'yeah, yeah'
signs of a surface that isn't getting any quicker. Dug in, around off. Khawaja gets underneath. The ball bounces well in front of the keeper.
back of a length outside off, keeps climbing this time but Khawaja. Lets it go nicely. Lifts his bat vertically
full outside off, generating decent pace is Rabada. Another watchful leave.

beauty. Pitches and seams away. 147 kph, back of a length in that fourth-stump channel. That angle means Khawaja is lulled into playing but the ball ducks away to beat the bat. Play that, out-of-form batsman.
tossed up around middle, worked away to midwicket
tossed up outside off, Bancroft runs down again and skews a drive to cover
the flatter one, 85 kph, quick and straight, nudged to square leg. Some oohs and aahs and whoas
79 kph, nicely bowled, flight outside off, Bancroft runs down and pushes the ball towards short mid-off
full outside off, nice loop. Bancroft is indecisive, but his eventual decision is a dab back
definitely clear in the mind this time. Sees some flight, runs down and drives with the spin to long-off. A controlled single
back of a length around middle, 146 kph, nudged to midwicket with the angle
full delivery outside off, driven back towards mid-off
full and wide, 148 kph, a neat drive to short cover, but that timing isn't there
good leave. Don't need to play every ball. Back of a length outside off, 142 kph, left alone
140 kph, digs this one in. Plenty of pace to force Bancroft to hurry underneath
runs! Leg byes! Four runs to Australia. A wild full toss that drifts down the leg side, just clips the pad en route to the fine leg boundary.
87 kph, flat outside off, Khawaja looking for the sweep but the ball is short enough to bounce over the sweep, hit his glove, then the body, then the bat, then the ground
shortish outside off, Khawaja reads the length early, goes back and blocks
chips down the track and defends this back

ooh, doesn't quite account for the spin. Flat outside off, swept fiercely to deep square leg. The shot means the ball will keep spinning away from Rabada, who ran to his left, but the ball beat his dive and went away
shortish outside off, nudged towards square leg.
80 kph, flight outside off, skids on as was evident with the ball taking the outside half towards point.
full outside off, blocked to cover
movement. 143 kph, back of a length, the ball moving back in, beats Bancroft on the inside edge and hits him on the back elbow.
140 kph, holds its line, excellent bowling. Back of a length outside off, tapped away towards point
drifts on the pads this time and Bancroft helps himself to four through backward square leg. Looking for the one that ducks back in sharply and hits Bancroft in front, but he drifts too much
full delivery outside off, 145 kph, driven to cover
a good length delivery outside off, the ball is too wide to draw a stroke, left alone

the reverse sweep! Bobbles up off something to the keeper, there is an appeal from SA. No, says ump Ravi, just forearm he thinks. SA review. A good one too because replays show the ball hit the glove before lobbing up. Khawaja's stuttering form continues. It's a slow surface, meaning the ball does not come on as quickly as Khawaja anticipated. He was through the shot far too early.
slow outside off, the ball turns away, 82 kph, off the outside half towards backward point
short, flat and wide. Smith asks what is that? Left alone
slow and straight, 80 kph, pushed away to midwicket
oh that's nice. Slow and loopy outside off, not as full. Smith strides out, hits the outside half to point
79 kph, overpitched on middle and leg, Smith is looking to drive through mid-on but the ball spins away to take the leading edge towards cover.
full outside off, 141 kph, off the outside half towards point
zoning in on that off stump! Full around off, the ball seaming back in, defended back
back of a length outside off, off the outside half again to point. Just have to keep it there.
full and wide outside off, 142 kph, left alone by Bancroft. That's a good leave
141 kph, back of a length outside off, Bancroft lets this one go.
a low full toss outside off, 143 kph, Bancroft drives back towards the bowler. Rabada sticks out his left hand to stop the ball.
should long-on be back? Flat on leg, driven to long-on for one. I'd want Smith hitting over mid-on when he is on 0
that's a boundary that du Plessis should not  mind. Bancroft comes down, and hits the ball over mid-on, despite not quite getting to the pitch. Plenty of risk
good batting. Faultless. Bancroft chips down and drives towards a deepish mid-on
flat outside off, hit back to the bowler
lovely bowling, slow outside off, the ball drops late and spins to beat Smith's outside edge. Yes, beat the edge.
slow outside off, driven to cover. More a block than a drive actually
gets it through, and four! Short and wide, a loosener. Bancroft doesn't let that one go, just scythes the cut in front of point
137 kph, some inward movement. Back of a length outside off, a thick inside edge towards square leg for one
140 kph, short and wide, carved to backward point.
shortish, back of a length and wide, 137 kph. Lets this one go.
a short delivery down leg, Bancroft lets that one pass too. Could have easily gloved that down leg, not a bad strategy

past backward point's left this time. Four more. Back of a length outside off, Bancroft gets on top of the bounce and cuts. With Morkel's height and a slow surface, it's a perfect cutting option. Slashed away.
slow outside off, spinning away, pushed back to the bowler
nice and slow around off, driven to short cover
lovely batting. Flicking against the spin, on middle and leg, worked away past midwicket's left for two
slow outside off, driven to cover from the back foot
smashed away for four more. Short and wide from Maharaj, tripe. Carved away through cover point for four. Too many runs leaking from a SA perspective.
shortish and straight, punched to long-on for one
a short delivery around off, Smith sways, not ducks.
back of a length outside off, chopped down to Amla at first slip
shortish around off, pulled down to fine leg for one, 135 kph
short again, and smashed to midwicket. Bancroft's fifty. That will help him a lot, in terms of confidence and otherwise. Sits up for Cam to pull over midwicket
another short delivery, lets this one pass harmlessly by

another fierce pull. I can't understand that tactic on a slow pitch. It's hardly troubling them, why persist? Short on middle and leg, so much time that Bancroft rolls his wrists and pulls to deep square leg without so much as a thought
flight outside off, Bancroft chips down and drives to long-off
drilled through cover, four more. 79 kph. runs are flowing. Flight outside off, Smith transfers his weight onto the front foot and crisply hits the ball past the infield.
flat and straight, a better length, 88 kph, spins and takes the outside half to point
82 kph, short on middle and leg, nudged to square leg
wants to come down but Maharaj flattens it out. Full and wide, pushed to point
nicely tossed up around off, pushed towards the bowler. 'Not now,' says Smithy. His wish commands.
full around off, 138 kph, pushed to mid-on. 'Not now,' says Smith. Then 'wait on'. Du Plessis hits the stumps at the batsman's end, the ball ricochets and out comes another 'not nowww'
full and wide, sliced off the open half towards deep cover. There is a run now.
144 kph, full on middle and leg, Bancroft falls over a flick, clips the pad for a leg bye to fine leg. That's a much better length on this surface. May have been sliding down
'not now' again from Smith. Full outside off, a solid bunt to cover
short, a bouncer on middle and off. Using it sparingly, as a surprise option is a much better way to bowl a bouncer. Smith ducks.
141 kph, full outside off, blocked back to Smith. A tidy over from Morkel, much better change in length.

and he strikes! Wow, that was uncanny. That is terrific bowling against a batsman set on using his feet. He knows Bancroft has been coming down often and driving him straight so what he does it toss it up (to invite him down) but bowl it discernibly wider (so that the ball spins away with Bancroft nowhere near the ball). That's exactly what happens. Bancroft is left stretching and the ball evades him. De Kock takes off the bails.
slow outside off, Marsh keeps the ball down as he defends
short outside off, hurries on. Marsh goes back to defend. Looking for the footholes outside off
Marsh comes down and defends, not quite to the pitch but watchfully defended
runs down and drills the ball to the right of mid-on for four. That's well played. Hit with the spin, using his feet, all safe options with the angle of spin.
slow outside off, defended by Marsh. End of a wily over. That's lunch on day 3
bustles in and hits a length around off, defended by Smith
full in the channel, Smith practically turns around and reverses across, punches to cover
touch short, Smith's rapier blade flashes through a standing square drive for a couple, well fielded in the deep by Markram
length, hops across outside off and stabs to cover
touch short and there's room for Smith to free the arm and cut one square
angled across on a length, Marsh stays anchored in the crease and lets it go
pushed through a little too straight and Smith glances fine, the ball outruns Philander to the rope
tossed up slower, tapped to leg
gives it some loop and drift, Smith closes the face and whips to midwicket
nice action on the ball, plenty of air, punched back to the bowler
flighted, pitching on leg stump and straightening, clipped off the pad to square leg
Smith drops back and rolls the wrists but works the ball to midwicket again
ooh, a teaser, garter-belt line outside off, Marsh fiddles as the ball thuds into de Kock's gloves
lovely shot, not all that full but Marsh gets well forward and thrashes a drive through the line for four to deep cover
touch shorter, comes across and shoulders arms
puts it on a length, nipping away around the line of off, no stroke again
good length, 129kph outside off, lets it go
fractionally shorter and defended coming across
Maharaj gives this plenty of air, drifting down the leg side and he misses out attempting to paddle the ball fine
looped up on middle and off, defended
dotted on off, touch quicker and Smith pushes to extra cover
flighted, driven back to the bowler
tossed up wide of the stumps, Smith drops back and cracks a cut shot but picks out cover
pushed through on the stumps, nurdled for one around the corner
trundles in and hits a length, defended on off
slightly short and Smith manufactures a whip behind square on the leg side from back in the crease
corridor-botherer on a length, Smith taps it square
pushed in a touch straighter, 136kph and blocked towards midwicket
wicket-to-wicket stuff, worked off the pads but square leg intercepts
drops short and it allows Smith to go back outside off and run a single to third man
angled in on off and defended
pushed through, Smith goes back to cut and gets a bottom edge
slightly short from Maharaj and he's slapped through the covers off the back foot, the man in the deep preventing four
floated up full, worked down the ground for one
uses the feet, picks out mid-off on the drive
floated up around off stump, tapped away
angled in straight and blocked
shouts of interest as the ball scoots through and Smith jabs it away
touch short, 132kph and rising up to hit the label as Smith defends
seaming in a fraction from outside off, punched down from the crease
fuller, gets him driving but again Smith is caged by SA's ring field
on the stumps, 132kph and defended
tossed up from over the wicket, steered towards cover
flighted, slow and loopy and patted back to the bowler coming forwards
angled in and play with the spin off the back foot, backward square leg cuts it off
floated up full, clipped down the ground to long-on
round the wicket, lobbed up and turned to leg

skidding on, raps the pads, huge appeal from South Africa... not given by S Ravi! But the review is quick to come and this looks close. He was playing for turn but the ball went on with the arm, the main question is did it hit him outside the line? Flicks the front pad first, he was well back, so it's certainly hitting off stump... don't think any bat involved. It's umpire's call, by millimetres! There wasn't quite 50% of the ball in line on impact, Lady Luck blows a raspberry at Maharaj and Smith will continue
Philander and his ball-on-a-string continue, tight lines and defended
comes across to defend
pushed across in the channel, lets it go through
Marsh reaches for the ball and it pops slightly aerially into the covers
slightly wide and again Marsh can leave
leg side, runs square off the pad as Marsh misses with a flick
tossed up, targeting off stump, Smith defends
pushed through flat and Smith drops deep to whip the ball away through midwicket, they come back for three
shouts of 'catch!' as Marsh chips through mid-on, no one there
flat outside off and cut forcefully towards point
tossed up and worked for a single
flighted, Marsh comes down the track and nudges one more through mid-on
angled across the left-hander from over the wicket, left alone
good length, 136kph outside off stump, nothing doing from Marsh
strays down the leg side, misses with a flick
oof, cuts him in half, seems to come on to Marsh quicker than he expected, zips over the stumps
probing around off stump, Marsh line this one up
straighter line, worked to the leg side
floated up on off, pushed to extra cover
Maharaj wheels away, stroked along the carpet into the off side and the fielders converge
flatter delivery outside off, punched to cover on the back foot
a touch wide, Smith is deep in the crease and lets it go
darted in on middle and leg, pushed through mid-on coming forwards
tossed up and spinning in slowly, defended

dug in, ripping short ball and Smith gets in a right two and eight, fending away to leg, bottom hand off the bat, doing everything possible not to be hit in the throat. But he survives and gets off strike, too
fullish, up in the 140s and Marsh taps away

skiddy and straight, thudding into the pads, again SA want the lbw! Rabada is convinced and again du Plessis goes for the review, but I think this may have pitched outside leg. Yep, Dharmasena has got this right, the ball was a touch short and zipped on, but didn't land in line; so SA lose one of their reviews
slams in the bouncer as a follow-up, Marsh weaves under it
slips in the yorker but it's leg side and Marsh keeps his eye on it, scrapes a toe of bat to pick up four past the keeper
full length, better line but Marsh nonchalantly bunts it towards mid-off
tossed up on off, driven to the man set back in the covers
flighted, Smith prods it away to the off side
gives this some air, Smith is reaching for a rubber-wristed drive, can't pierce the ring
comes across and taps into the covers again
floated up nicely, Smith reaches out to defend
tossed up wide of the stumps and Smith's bottom hand comes into play again, this time he gets the drive through for one
looped up, plenty of air but a touch leg side, patted back to the bowler
this time Smith dinks one down the ground to long-off
over the wicket, lets go a full toss which Marsh clips down the ground

tosses up a full delivery, Smith tries to paddle sweep and is struck in front! This time Dharmasena gives it, though Smith looks aghast and immediately reviews! No saving him this time, however, it's a beauty from Elgar, drifting and straightening down the line of leg stump and it sends Smith packing!
flight outside off, driven to cover
smashed through cover! Very loopy outside off, Mitch strides forward and says not to me, mate with a languid drive through cover.
a waft. Back of a length outside off, shaping away, Marsh's prod goes nowhere, the ball evades him
good length outside off, driven to mid-off. Rabada getting the ball to move away from Shaun M.
full and straight, driven to mid-on. A checked shot. He has to be careful of that ball ducking back in.
full outside off, the ball moving away just a touch. That's a good length for this surface, skewed to point
back of a length outside off, climbing steeply. Marsh lifts his hands vertically to let it go
nailed! But straight to midwicket. A shortish delivery sits up for Shaun to pummel, but he picks out the fielder.
slow and beats the outside edge. Yummy. It's very slow, extracts a bit of turn and it goes past
tossed up outside off, driven to cover
short outside off, very slow, sits up for Mitch to push to the bowler
very slow outside off, Marsh comes down and smothers the spin
slow outside off again, 78 kph, driven to cover. A maiden!
back of a length on middle, 137 kph, a thick inside edge down to fine leg
full and straight, 139 kph, looking for the yorker, a thick inside edge to square leg
full and moving back in, a thick inside edge towards midwicket
well bowled, this one pitches and moves away, Shaun Marsh lifts his hands to let it go. A very watchful leave, he's moving the ball both ways.
a bouncer, short, but too wide outside off. Shaun M didn't quite see that but it was so wide outside off.
looking for the yorker, ends up as a low full toss, pushed away towards mid-off via the leading edge
tossed up around off, Mitch Marsh winds up and drills a drive to mid-on, mist-timed slightly, but makes the run easily.
sees Shaun Marsh coming so he slows this up and wide outside off, hammered to cover, the ball is half-stopped so two more
slow and straight, worked into the leg side.
flight again, Shaun Marsh reaches out for it and mis-times it into the off side.
excellently played and equally well fielded. Slowed up outside off, driven away to Faf's right at mid-off. Gets across and saves runs
slow down leg, 74 kph, worked away into the leg side
flat and quick around off, nudged to midwicket from the back foot
slow around off, Shaun Marsh watchfully smothers the ball
flatter trajectory outside off, he goes back and keeps it out
chips down the track, looking to work the ball into the leg side but Maharaj just subtly shortened the length, allowing the ball to turn, hit on the pads
clipped to midwicket
excellent maiden. Very probing. Shortish around off but quick, so not much time for Shaun Marsh to skip forward, nudged to square leg

edged and gone! It's the other one, the one that pitches and moves away. Sweet reverse-swing bowling. Good length outside off, the shine of the ball is the other way so it moves away from the right-hander, who feels he has to play because there is the big possibility of the one ducking back in. A thick outside edge at a comfortable height for Amla at first slip. SA have many problems, but slip catching isn't one of them. Amla's 100th Test catch
135 kph, good length around off, tapped towards gully
good length and wide outside off, left alone
wide of the crease goes Rabada, bowls a fuller length and asks T-Paine to drive but he isn't lulled yet. A terrific delivery is very well played. Cricket at its finest.
good length outside off, left alone again.
two successive maidens. Some pressure on Australia, not in the context of the match, but they're just having to rebuild. Good length and wide outside off, left alone
83 kph, flat outside off, spinning in, Marsh misses a flick and is struck on the pad juust outside the line
shimmies down and works the ball into the leg side for one. Excellent cricket, a shame that SA are so far behind in the game.
slow outside off, the ball spins away. Paine leaves again
calls for the single and makes it, a full delivery around off, driven away to mid-on and a good early call of 'yeah, yeah'

another big shout for lbw! Flat outside off, Marsh went right back, but the ball spun back in and hit him outside the line of off. SA review. Marsh was beaten on the inside edge, but he was so deep in the crease that SA felt they needed to review. One red, followed by two umpire's calls on HawkEye. To be fair to umpire S Ravi, that one didn't look out. Wasn't a howler either, so what's the problem? Carry on.
tossed up outside off, 88 kph, defended into the off side
back of a length around off, 134 kph, climbs on Paine as he looks to defend.
good single again, 135 kph, fullish outside off, pushed away through point for a run
full and moving away outside off, the ball moving away, takes the outside half towards point.
full again, 136 kph, the ball takes the outside half and slices away behind point for a couple.

how did that miss off stump? Full and swinging back in, Paine is far too late on that, the ball somehow beats his back pad and his bat (that has come down as a tomorrow afterthought) isn't close to the ball.
full and wide, moving away, sliced to deep point for another run.
slow around off, the ball pitches and spins away to beat the outside edge. Another lovely delivery
shortish around off, too slow. Paine sees a scoring opportunity but mis-times a cut towards cover
quicker delivery, wide outside off, left alone
slow on the pads, why did he have to switch his nagging line? Paine works him away through midwicket for two
shortish and wide, pushed to a deep-ish extra cover. An initial call of 'noo' then 'come on'
slow and full outside off, smothered away
full and straight, 131 kph, pushed to mid-off
full and seaming back, 133 kph, moving back in, defended. Very Stuart Clark-like bowling.
133 kph, another good single. Full around off, pushed to mid-on. Paine realises Rabada has just bowled a spell so he calls yes

full and swinging down! A big big appeal from Philander, but that one was moving too much. A full delivery is moving back in late, Marsh misses a flick. Faf, Vern and QdK deliberate, they decide to review but Dharmasena says no more time left.
full and moving down again, off the pad towards fine leg.
full and moving away late, defended to cover
full and on the pads, nudged away to midwicket for one
tossed up around off and middle, 78 kph, driven to cover
short and wide outside off, 82 kph, scythed away towards backward point. But the ball goes right through Faf, awkward spin and nutmegs the captain.
slow on middle, hard-handed Paine blocks the ball past silly point. Maharaj now wants silly point straighter.
full and straight, another defensive block
good end, more flight on middle, 78 kph, kept out. Good comeback
full and moving back in, Marsh defends to mid-on
full outside off, 135 kph, coming back in, defended to cover
full outside off, the ball moving away, off the outside half towards point
full on middle, blocked to mid-off, 135 kph
because he was angling that away, left alone.
full on the pads, nudged to square leg
slow around off, 77 kph, tapped towards point
tossed up on middle and leg, driven to a deep mid-on for a single. Good call of yes too

taken at short leg! But is there bat, or just pad. No says umpire Ravi. But yes, says Faf. No, again says the umpire. They've taken too long again. And it saves them a review because the bat was nowhere near the ball.
on the bounce to midwicket, tossed up outside off, worked away but on the bounce to the fielder.

and taken at slip, on the stroke of tea. Maharaj takes three. Paine wants the third umpire to check if it has carried. De Villiers raises his finger. So does S Ravi for the soft signal. For many of these catches, there is some hesitation, but this one isn't even close to the ground so Australia lose their sixth. Another nice piece of bowling, slow and wide outside off, not full not short, drawing Paine forward and then the ball spinning away.
stays round the wicket, lobbed up outside off, Cummins lets it go
ooh, this scoots through low, ungainly looking shot from Marsh, prodding and missing
wicket-to-wicket and worked to the leg side
pitched up around the line of off, driven along the carpet to mid-off
touch short and Marsh rasps a cut past the dive of point, plenty of power on that as it bounces away to the rope
straighter, still back of a length and it deflects to the leg side off the pads
good length. 134kph on middle stump, defended back down the track
tossed up on off, Cummins taps it away
gets a stride in and smothers the ball
angled in a touch flatter, stays in the crease and defends down in front of his toes
pushed through, lines it up and blocks
flighted, probing lines and defended diligently
tossed up, gets him driving, nicely played by Cummins and he gets off the mark with a couple out towards deep extra cover
sliding across, mid-130s kph and steered away square on the off side
good length on the stumps, Marsh blocks
stumps-to-stumps, keeper standing up, the batsman hemmed in... he blocks
overpitched and that is dispatched neatly past midwicket, mid-on turns to give chase but won't reel it in
tight on the stumps, better length and blocked
leg-stump line, Marsh just pats a length delivery towards mid-on
looped up and straightening a foot or so outside off, left alone
angled in on the stumps, Cummins defends
darted quicker and Cummins has to chop down hurriedly to play it away in front of off stump
flighted, pushed towards mid-off
loopy and a touch wide, breaking away as Cummins stretches out to smother it
full and flighted, blocked stoutly coming across
over the wicket, back of a length and defended around off stump
short, angling away as Marsh raises the bat in an arc
closer to the stumps, defended
short again, sliding towards the cordon as Marsh ignores it
back of a length, blocked coming across on off
unthreatening from Morkel, too high and wide, left alone once more
flighted, lets this one spin through outside off
ooh, that's close, a bit of a waft from Cummins, the ball turned sharply and disappeared into the keeper's gloves... nothing on it, though
straighter line and tucked off the pads
floated up full on off, prodded towards extra cover
touch short and Cummins tries to disperse the catchers, throws the bat but miscues towards cover
tossed up and blocked coming forwards
back of a length, 139kph and rising in the channel outside off, left alone
straighter line and Marsh defends

there's the breakthrough, Marsh steers to second slip! Morkel finds a channel to provoke some indecision in the batsman and he pushes at it, gets a thick outside edge which de Villiers stays low to snaffle
back of a length, 144kph and Starc stands tall, prods it away
pitched up from a great height, tailing away - think Morkel is getting some reverse here - and Starc swings wildly and misses
flighted, tapped away on off
angled in, doughty defence remains the order of the day as far as Cummins is concerned
flat delivery outside off and Cummins stabs down on it
gets a touch leg side and Cummins flicks him fine for a couple - first run in five overs for Australia
floated up outside off, punched into the covers
flighted, in the slot, and Cummins heaves six over wide long-on! Tuk-tuk boom from Cummins, but he's a strong fellow and absolutely belted that
angled across, draws the tentative prod... but a thick outside edge whizzes through gully for four!
touch short and curling away as Starc chase it again, whistles past the edge into de Kock's gloves
back of a length, 137kph and jabbed into the covers
stays in the crease and steers the ball square
pitched up and Starc flashes a drive, comes off the outside edge but skips short of Elgar at point
fullish length around off, punched to extra cover on the up
ooh, nicely bowled, spinning sharply away as Cummins feels for it playing back
lobbed up and blocked half forwards
pushed through outside off, lets this go through to the keeper
wider line, stays low and again there's not shot offered
drifting in with the arm and worked through the leg side
over the wicket, fired flat on the stumps and Starc scythes one more through square leg
hurled down in the channel, 137kph and climbing from back of a length, left alone
tighter line, 143kph/89mph and Starc prods it into the covers
dug in short at the body and Starc flips it away to midwicket for one, bringing up the Australia 200
length ball in the channel, clocked at 148kph as Cummins gets on to the front foot and shoulders arms
goes for the throat ball, short and nasty as the ball comes buzzing back, Cummins phlegmatically sways out the way
shortish outside off, no stroke offered
over the wicket, spinning in from outside off, defended playing back
tosses up the tempter and Starc obliges, 'catch!' is the call but the slog-sweep comes high off the bat and bounces well in front of the two men out
pushed through outside off and Cummins thick-edges a few wide of slip
tossed up and blocked on off
Cummins gets on to the front foot and taps the ball away
lobbed up from round the wicket, defended coming forwards
fired across the bows, blocked

pitched up and hammered - but Elgar grabs a screamer in the covers! He may have injured his hand, in fact, as he runs off the field straight away... but Starc will follow him, there'll be no boom-boom this time, Australia eight down
fullish around off stump, 149kph and Lyon pats it back to the bowler
dug in back of a length, hits the body and loops wide of de Kock who does well to grab it diving to his left
bumper, 143kph and inviting Lyon to smell the leather, he sways nonchalantly under it
pitched up in the channel, flings the bat without moving the feet and gets nowhere near it
fires a length delivery down the leg side
length, the ball grubs as Cummins drops the bat, gets a thick, low edge wide of slip and it runs away for four
short, only 128kph but it nips back and hits Cummins on the thigh
hits that spot on a length outside off and the ball keeps low again, defended by Cummins
banged in and jabbed towards point on the back foot
ach, good ball, good response, reversing in at Cummins, who manages to get the bat down in time and block
back of a length, angling in and worked off the pads behind square for a single
dug in, 139kph and veering back as Cummins sways underneath it
short again, good carry through but Cummins just stays inside the line
banged in, 141kph and blocked on the back foot
that's a good line, 144kph around off stump and Cummins fends at it, thick-edged on the bounce to slip
pitched up and driven without timing towards mid-off
short and defended resolutely in front of the stumps
pitched up closer to the batsman, who pushes a drive to mid-on

dropped! Lyon reaches outside off and diverts a rapid chance towards second slip, AB de Villiers got both hands up but shelled the chance! Maybe didn't pick it up quickly enough. Groans echo around Kingsmead
banged in short and Lyon ducks it
touch back of a length, 130kph and punched through the covers off the back foot
bumper to finish the over, Cummins is quickly down on his haunches

edged and gone! 139 kph, and Lyon nicks off to first slip. Real danger for South Africa now. A lovely delivery, good length in a channel outside off, the ball pitches and moves away. Lyon drives, gets a thick outside edge which flies low to Amla at first slip, who gets forward and takes a good 'un.
a full delivery outside off, 140 kph, driven to mid-off.
short and wide outside off, 140 kph, right in the cutting arc but Hazlewood makes no contact.
nicely played. Morkel is too full and driven through mid-off and that takes Australia's lead over 400
a languid drive through cover for three to begin the day. 141 kph, full and angling away. A leaden-footed drive through cover. Elgar chases it down.
back of a length around off, 135 kph, nudged to midwicket.
flight outside off, Hazlewood uses his long reach to defend
the wild sweep, tossed up outside off, Hazlewood gets low but misses the heave. Struck on the body
88 kph, quick and full, smothered back

84 kph, flat outside off, another attempted sweep, another appeal as the ball hits pad. But that looked like it struck the pad outside the line. But Faf asks why not review and makes the T sign. No bat. Well outside the line of off says HawkEye, so poor review. Needless.
flat on off, Hazlewood works the ball through square leg for one
slow around off, 85 kph, nicely kept out. Good length from Kesh
back of a length delivery, angling away, punched to mid-off from the crease
the bouncer around off, 144 kph. Hazlewood sways and looks to dab the ball over the slips, but he's not a good enough batsman to make contact with the pace of Morne

lobs to mid-on, on the bounce! A slower ball, a lovely variation to the No. 11. Hazlewood is through his shot too early, just pitches in front of Faf. A direct hit at the bowler's end asks for the third umpire to check, but all good.
a length delivery around off, Cummins clears his front leg and swats one to mid-on. T20 terminology in commentary, rare!
another short, slower ball. Cummins watches the ball onto his bat and then guides the ball over AB at second slip. Just evades the fielder
full and wide, 137 kph, pushed to cover. Already a frustrating morning for SA
heaved away into no-man's land at midwicket. Slow through the air, around middle. Morne at long-on runs around
there's six for Australia. A tossed up delivery is deposited into the grass banks over midwicket with a well-timed slog sweep!
slow on middle and leg, Cummins blocks

dragged on, and Maharaj has four. He tossed that up wider outside off, Cummins chooses to drag the slog sweep instead of hitting through the off side. It's a risky option. The ball takes the inside edge and clips the side of leg stump. Australia all out for 227, setting SA 417 to win the first Test
swing! Almost knocks down off stump. I guess that's a good leave. Full delivery outside off, pitched outside and swung back in. Would have broken a fifth stump
a low full toss and SA are away. A full toss, swinging in the air, punched away into the gap at cover for four. Easy runs.
good length delivery outside off, 141 kph, fifth-stump line, some inward movement. But off the middle of the bat to point
a good length delivery around off, 141 kph, off the outside edge towards gully for two, to the right of the fielder
goes short does Starc, 144 kph bouncer outside off, Markram ducks
full delivery around off, 147 kph, blocked to mid-off. Nice defensive stride
full delivery outside off, pushed away to mid-off. Interestingly, a short cover in place, no third slip.
back of a length around off, solidly defended towards point
through that gully region for four. Fullish length, the ball angling away. Elgar gets a thick outside edge which dies down and races away through the vacant region.
on a length and straight, 138 kph, defended back confidently
full and wide outside off, 134 kph, left alone
dug in short around off, Elgar gets underneath
full and wide, angling this away. Markram goes reaching at that, under-edges that through to gully.
a nice punchy push through cover. Back of a length outside off, Markram stands tall and punches through cover for one. Nicely played.
a length delivery outside off, 148 kph, Elgar stands tall and lets this one go
good length outside off, left alone, 146 kph.
drifts on the pads and Elgar clips him away easily through square leg. Starc strays and nicely worked behind square for four.
full delivery outside off, solidly defended to cover
shortish and wide outside off, Markram sees width, his eyes light up and he cuts fiercely through backward point. Nice
goes short this time, 138 kph. Markram pulls, a top edge on the bounce to fine leg. Starc gets across
a full delivery outside off, Elgar looks to drive but mis-times it towards mid-on
full and wide outside off, asking Elgar to drive. Not yet. Left alone
goes short, on middle, 136 kph, Elgar takes his bottom hand off the bat as he defends. It actually raps him on the glove.
good length but too wide outside off, left alone again
'there it is,' is the call from someone in the slips. That's how he got out in the first innings. A short delivery on the ribs, Markram gets on top of the bounce to keep it down towards short leg
past point for four. A short delivery outside off, Markram gets on top of the bounce and cuts in front of point. Races away. This is good proactive batting from Markram
full and straight, the ball attacking the pads, Markram defends back with the full face.
another well-directed short delivery on middle, Markram is hurried but chooses a good shot, ducks underneath
back of a length outside off, 142 kph, defended towards point. Dharmasena has a chat with Starc, probably something to do with walking near the danger area
148 kph, drifts down leg, Markram wants to attack but it's too far down. Would have been close to wide to a left-hander in white-ball cricket.
on the pads, full. No flick this time as Elgar defends
strays down leg, nudged past short leg for a run. That will make him feel better
shortish and quick, outside off, Markram goes back and lets that one go
ooh, plays for more turn than there is, flat outside off, plenty of drift. Beaten on the outside edge
shortish outside off, watchfully patted back
strays on the pads, 89 kph, nudged to deep square leg again.
too straight again and Markram flicks him away again. Short down leg, clipped away through midwicket, three more runs. Vast expanses of unoccupied real estate
full delivery outside off, defended, 143 kph, no need to play at that one
good length and wide outside off, 144 kph, left alone. Nearly a no-ball!
full outside off, driven towards mid-off. Elgar thinks of one before rightly calling 'waaait'

edged and gone! There's Australia's first. A back of a length delivery outside off, the ball bounces extra. Elgar is lulled into playing but the ball keeps climbing. Elgar tries to withdraw the bat, but it's too late, he can't improvise quickly enough against a bowler with Starc's pace. He gets a thin edge through to T-Paine.
goes short first up. The good thing is that it's excellently directed and not a wasted bouncer. Amla stands tall and plays it back down the pitch very well, but that's sure to wake him up!
'that's gorgeous bowling,' says Paine. Slow outside off, defended back.
83 kph, off the inside edge but well past short leg, some flight around middle and leg, through to deep square leg
plays it later and inside the crease, very watchfully defended
slow around off, turned away to midwicket. 87 kph, playing it typically late
short around off, turns back in, played neatly into the leg side
very nicely played, goes right back and works the ball to deep square leg to get off the dreaded pair.
a good length delivery outside off, not much movement. Left alone.
edged, short of second slip! Full delivery outside off, a thick outside edge to second slip, but that's Amla's very soft hands at play.
a wasted delivery, full and pushed very wide outside off, moving away. Looking to get the ball to swing away. Left alone

full around off, and middle, those were the deliveries that went past Amla in the reverse series in Australia. Defended back nicely this time, right behind the line, head over the ball, eyes are on it.
full again, on middle and leg, 145 kph, played away to midwicket
full around off, defended back with the full face.
turn and bounce, half a chance for short leg! Lyon nearly bags his first, the ball spits at Markram who punches it past Bancroft, he got a hand up but was never catching it
tossed up and Amla skelps four through the leg side, wristy magnificence and it beats the man in the deep
pushed through outside off, lets this go
flighted, stays in the crease and works the ball with the spin for one
looped up, Markram is quick to come down, smothers the ball in defence
floated a touch wide of the stumps, tapped towards cover
good length, 144kph around off and Amla gets into line
pitched up, drifting into the pads and it's flicked neatly behind square for a couple
back of a length, 144kph, rising in the corridor as Amla shoulders arms
banged in, ticklish bouncer and Amla tucks his arms in as it heads leg side

goes straight, raps the pads, and after a prolonged appeal up goes Dharmasena's finger! Amla has missed it... but he asks for a review, possibly in hope more than expectation. He had crept across his stumps and this looks to be hitting: yep, umpire's call on the top of leg stump and he has to go, removed by Hazlewood for the sixth time in Tests
back of a length wide of off stump, 140kph and de Villiers lets it bounce through
looped up outside off, spinning a touch as Markram comes across to defend
HUGE appeal, Markram defeated on the back foot... outside the line? He jumped across and the ball kept low, thudded into the back pad; but Australia don't review this time
uses the feet, tapped down the leg side and Bancroft slow-motions an underarm towards the stumps as Markram returns to ground his bat
tossed up on off, defended
excitement behind the stumps, Smith is dancing up from slip... Beat the outside edge, into the gloves and then Paine dislodges the bails for good measure, but it's as you were

oh dear, de Villiers is run out at the non-striker's end! Calamitous! What is going on here...? Markram worked the ball behind square on the leg side, de Villiers called and was halfway down when Markram indicated he wasn't interested - having initially taken a couple of steps - Warner then fired a flat throw to Lyon and AB was nowhere near getting back, desperately stumbling and diving for the crease! Utter shambles, and Australia have knocked another brick from the wall
shortish and worked away off the body to square leg
good length around fourth stump, defended coming across
fired in straight and du Plessis taps it away to the leg side
touch short outside off, 146kph/90mph and zipping through as Faf shoulders arms
jumps wide and angles the ball in, chopped down in defence

jeepers, that's a searing attempted yorker, 140kph and zeroing in on middle and leg stump, but du Plessis plays it superbly and pings four through midwicket, jammed the bat down to keep it out and the pace takes it to the boundary rope
tossed up wide of off stump, Markram blocks
uses the feet and gets out to smother the danger
gives it some loop, again met on the front foot
pushed a little flatter, around off stump and Markram squares up to block
fired down quickly outside off and it's neatly clipped in front of square as Markram gets out, doesn't quite run for four
pushed through, du Plessis hops into line and defends
ooh, teasing line and Markram is late on it, just dips past the toe of the bat as he wafts outside off
tighter to off stump, defended towards extra cover
angled in on the pads, 144kph and Markram works the ball to mid-on
in the channel, scoots through a little low as Markram swings wildly at it and misses
bumper, well-directed but Markram turtles out of the way
pitched up, 144kph/89mph and tailing in towards off, Markram blunts a drive to cover point for one
flighted, dipping outside off and defended pressing forwards
fizzing through and clipped towards cover
Lyon probing away around off stump, more steadfast defence from Markram
bounce off a length and this loops to short leg, shouts of 'catch it!' but everyone quickly realises that went off the hip
tossed up and met with a forward block
Lyon gives it some air, steps down and pushes a single through mid-on to keep the strike
starts with a nagging line, just back of a length, 145kph and defended on the back foot
touch straighter, waits in the crease and turns one through midwicket

off stump out of the ground! Cummins you relentless beauty! Du Plessis is run through, he left a bit of a gap and Cummins sought it out like bloodhound picking up a scent, perfect length to hit the top of off and send it cartwheeling several feet back. What a sight that is, Australia are running rampant
tight line on off and de Bruyn gets across to block
dug in short, feisty bumper that whirs through at head height, TdB ducks
lickety-split from Cummins, touches 150kph as the batsman comes across to defend
ooh, this skids though, takes the inside edge and squirts fine for one - SA raise a rather limp 50
lobbed up from over the wicket, met on the front foot
straighter line, tapped to the on side
quicker, on middle and off as de Bruyn stands tall in the crease to defend
gets across to block
flighted, spinning in on off stump, shows it a straight bat
touch short and leg side and the ball deflects away off the thigh pad behind square
searching line and length from Cummins, defended on off stump
yammering away around fourth stump, blocked again
goes a touch too straight again and de Bruyn nudges a couple through midwicket to get off the mark
good length, met coming forwards and pushed to mid-on
slams the ball down short and TdB again ducks the bouncer
floated up and clipped back down the ground, briefly in the air but it skips by Lyon for a single
pushed through and de Bruyn jabs it down towards short leg
gives this a touch more flight, defended with bat thrust out in front of pad
sliding in straighter, tapped to leg from in front of middle stump
flat offbreak, defended on the back foot
tossed up wide and TdB sticks out his front pad, there's a concerted appeal for lbw, as he's not playing a stroke - but S Ravi isn't interested
whoosh, pace and bounce and the ball screams past the outside edge as Markram flirts with a back-foot drive
short of a length, 139kph and defended square
over the top of off, Markram hangs back and steers the ball to point again
comes across and defends in front of the stumps
pinged through backward point, that was a nifty shot, stays still and drives behind square at the top of the bounce, the ball races away
dug in short, 145kph and jabbed down past the lurking short leg
tossed up outside off, Markram plunges on to the front foot and defends
faster delivery and this time he adjusts to poke it away on the back foot
clouted back down the ground! Slightly overpitched by Lyon and Markram rattles the sabres with a crunching straight drive
ooh, jabbed away off bat and pad but between the two leg-side catchers! Sharp spin for Lyon, clips the inside edge but the batsman gets some luck
pushed through and he lines this one up
flighted, Markram comes across and blocks, taking his team to lunch - he's played a defiant hand but the vultures are circling
good length, and straight, played towards midwicket.
holds its line, 142 kph, on a length outside off, de Bruyn looks to punch that but the ball beats the outside edge.
full and straight, 144 kph, attacking the stumps, defended back
keeps low and nearly goes through! Full on the pads, de Bruyn wants to flick but all he can manage is an under-edge, rather luckily for him
goes short, down leg, de Bruyn can't quite get bat on it so he leaves it be
140 kph, maiden to start after the break. Back of a length around off, worked to midwicket
flight from Lyon outside off, Markram gets forward, closes any gap between bat and pad and blocks
slightly short outside off, 86 kph, Markram goes back and punches a drive into the gap at cover for two
nicely played again, 88 kph, runs to the pitch and works the ball to wide mid-on for a run
slow outside off, full enough for the batsman to smother
a well-placed sweep, tossed up outside off, de Bruyn nails the sweep through backward square leg. Picked the delivery to attack
flight outside off, de Bruyn offers nothing but pad
full and straight, attacking the pads, pushed to mid-on
full and straight again, driven to mid-on with the full face of the bat
short delivery on middle, 145 kph, Markram ducks
back of a length outside off, defended into the off side, 141 kph
143 kph, full on middle and leg, flicked into the gap at midwicket for three. Nicely played.
another good single, on the pads, nudged away towards wide mid-on for one. Well played.
slow outside off, 86 kph, takes the inside edge towards leg gully
hitting against the turn, 87 kph, flight outside off, driven to mid-off
tossed up outside off, 89 kph, smothered
nails the reverse-sweep this time, flight outside off, nicely executed. Over the bounce, keeps it down but no one there anyway
flight outside off, 87 kph, smothered back
nicely tossed up outside off, 86 kph, de Bruyn defends off the back foot
full delivery outside off, fourth-stump channel, right behind the line. Has shown off his defensive game today
139 kph, back of a length on middle and off, nudged to wide mid-on for a run
back of a length around off, right behind the line is de Bruyn. Very important to show everyone that these two have the Test tempo.
beautifully bowled, 140 kph, full outside off, the ball holding its line, de Bruyn plays and then pulls his bat back
good change in length, well played too. A short delivery outside off, 142 kph, de Bruyn drops his hands and sways out of the line. Excellent evasive technique.
shortish delivery outside off, right behind the line to defend
87 kph, lots of loop and flight outside off, drilled to mid-on
shortish and wide outside off, 89 kph, Markram just watches it go
spin! Lots of it, slow outside off, short enough to allow the ball to turn quite a bit, hits Markram on the pad outside the line
flight outside off, off the inside edge towards midwicket
quick and flat, 88 kph, attacking off stump, played away to midwicket
slow outside off, 91 kph. right behind the line is Markram after a gentle, forward press
a good leave, full and wide outside off, 147 kph. Not lulled into playing that
shortish and wide outside off, punched to cover from the crease. No feet movement
good leave again. It's not only full and outside off, but also moving away. 139 kph. Gets forward and lets that one go
back of a length outside off, 145 kph, tapped towards point from the crease
a good length delivery outside off, 146 kph, swatted away towards Warner at mid-off. A loud no this time
back of a length outside off, punched to cover from the back foot
slow through the air, around middle, played away into the leg side
lovely shot. Runs down to the pitch, not quite there but goes through with a lofted drive over mid-off.
flat outside off, 91 kph, turns back in, right behind the line to defend
driven with the spin to a deep mid-on. Loud cheers for Markram's fifty, a good innings, but he needs to show he can make more.
slow through the air, the ball spinning back in, takes the inside edge into the pad
shortish outside off, 94 kph, nudged to deep midwicket for one
143 kph, full delivery outside off, driven neatly back to Starc, who reaches low to cut the ball off
full outside off, driven towards short cover, 144 kph
another full delivery outside off, 145 kph, pushed away to mid-off
overpitched outside off, not moving away too much, allows de Bruyn to drive freely, finds cover
well bowled, a well-directed bouncer on middle and leg, 142 kph. De Bruyn sways away well, keeps his eyes on the ball till as late as possible
fine shot! 142 kph, a low full toss on off and flicked away gleefully through midwicket. Sublime timing.
runs down to the pitch again, 93 kph, pushed to mid-off
shortish and slow, the ball turning in, defended back
short and wide, too short and Markram goes back and nails a cut to the sweeper cover boundary. Not the pitch to pay cross-batted strokes but it was there for the shot.
more turn outside off, 88 kph, he's right forward to defend
nicely bowled and played, 91 kph, defended away
through cover this time, four more, 90 kph, lots of flight outside off. Drilled against the turn through cover for four. Full enough to play against the turn.
back of a length around off, clipped into the gap at midwicket, 144 kph
beauty! A full delivery outside off, holds its line and then moves away after pitching to beat the bat!
144 kph, drifts on the pads, Markram wanted to flick but the ball just moves in, hit away to mid-on
moves away. It's now moving away late. Full outside off, leaves de Bruyn's bat hanging in the wind
on a length around middle and leg, nudged away to midwicket
beaten again. Too good! Full outside off, the ball moves away late and beats de Bruyn. Some words from Starc.
full and wide, right in the driving arc, Markram hits the ball back to the bowler as he looks to force a drive
133 kph, a yorker around off, worked away towards midwicket
135 kph, full outside off, pushed away towards mid-off
full outside off, some inward movement. Markram mis-times a drive to mid-off
nicely bowled, full and straight, using that shine to bring the ball back in towards middle, blocked
a good maiden, full and straight, played into the leg side with the angle of swing

goes through slip and the keeper. Short and wide outside off, 146 kph, de Bruyn looks to thrash a cut, takes the thick edge and goes right in the gap between the keeper and first slip. Probably T-Paine's catch
full around off, defended watchfully this time, 144 kph
terrific batting. Overpitched outside off, de Bruyn offers the full face of the bat and nails the straight drive to the right of mid-off. 149 kph
good length delivery around off, defended into the cover region. Starc has a monologue with de Bruyn
oh yeah! 140 kph, full and wide outside off, nailed through cover for four. Sensational timing. It's now a dialogue! That's what confidence does.
144 kph, full outside off, the ball pitches and moves away to beat the bat. Starc is seething now. He has overstepped.
back of a length delivery around off, de Bruyn is right behind the line. A sarcastic smile from Starc and some words. What an over that was. 13 runs, lots of words, some chances.
nailed through cover! What a period of batting this is. Full and wide outside off, caressed through cover with sensational timing. Markram is right into this now.
good leave. That is so important to do when the going gets easier, leave well. Good length outside off, left alone.
almost chops on. 132 kph, good length outside off, inside-edged into the pad
on the pads this time, 137 kph, off the pad to midwicket. May have felt he missed out on some runs there.
moving back in quite prodigiously. Full on off, defended away
short and wide outside off this time, carved away to the sweeper cover for a single.

and that won't help his mood, full outside off and rammed through the covers for four! Flowing swing of Markram's bat and the crowd hoot and whistle in appreciation - they've enjoyed the last half hour
fired full and a touch wide, Markram chops down on it
back of a length, looking for that devilish reverse, defended from the crease

pitched up a bit more, 146kph and stunned back along the ground, Starc goes to puck up and throw - but doesn't collect cleanly (and de Bruyn hadn't left his ground, either, but I suspect that's beside the point)
speared in, TdB chops down and deflects the ball back into his pads
slung down very full on off, 149kph but doesn't really tail much and he can squeeze it out to point
fullish, around middle and off, clipped back through mid-on
pitched up in the channel, 139kph and de Bruyn steps across and picks out extra cover
back of a length, up above 140kph now and de Bruyn is fractionally late on a pull that dribbles to mid-on off the splice
in the channel, mooches across and lets it go
touch short of a length, 136kph/84mph and seaming back as TdB cuts and sends it bobbling towards cover
angling in on the stumps and nudged away
short of a length, zipping through outside off as Markram hangs back and feels for it
banged in, 146kph and jabbed away to fine leg for one
full, no signs of this changed ball doing too much yet, driven on the bounce towards mid-off
length and shaping away a touch as de Bruyn comes across and leaves
gets a fraction too straight and TdB works it through midwicket
short, 141kph and he rides the bounce to drop the ball in front of square
tossed up and de Brruyn sweeps calmly through square for one
flighted, spins and takes the inside edge, but pops in front of short leg! Still think Lyon will have a say here... Looks like that ball dislodged a bit of the pitch, too
lobbed up, presses out to defend
full and flighted around off stump, mistimed on the drive but it bobbles through mid-on
floated up full, driven back to the bowler

ripping offbreak, de Bruyn trapped on the back foot, hit on the knee roll... But was it doing too much? The ball ended up in the hands of slip, but there was no bat involved. Lyon was imploring for the decision, but then indicates it may have turned down leg and Smith decides against the review
good length, comes across to defend on off
nicely played, goes back and slices a drive past point, into a gap in the deep for a couple
nibbling away in the channel, tapped square
fullish length, 143kph outside off and gets him driving, keeps it down for a single to deep point
angling in, touch full and de Bruyn punches firmly to mid-on
shortish and crisply driven in front of square off the back foot, Lyon has to put in the dive on the rope to prevent four
tossed up on off, prodded back to the bowler
flighted, a touch too straight and Markram works it with the turn through mid-on for one
pushed through, full on off and de Bruyn sweeps confidently off his front pad to deep midwicket
darted flatter outside off, blocked towards cover
steps down and drills one to long-on
goes round the wicket, floated up on the stumps and nudged square

climbs from a length, de Bruyn feels for it, nicks one behind! Paine nearly did a full 360 on taking that and there wasn't much of an appeal, but Hazlewood knew... The spell stand is broken! A gutsy knock from de Bruyn but his patience was tested, bit of extra pace and bounce on that and it was just too good
angled across the southpaw towards the slips, left alone
probing in the channel, maybe a touch short and wide enough for de Kock to ignore again
135kph length delivery, gets on to the front foot and leaves
dug in down the leg side and de Kock thinks about pulling, tries to get out of the way and ends up gloving it wide of the diving Paine
touch fuller, 132kph and met on the front foot with a defensive push square
tossed up outside off and met on the front foot
Markram shuffles across and lets the ball spin through
flighted, full outside off and pushed into the covers coming forwards

tossed up, sharp turn inside the bat and it raps the pad, diverts to slip, Australia go up... not given but they review, hoping for an inside edge, I think. Doesn't look as if he hit it on inspection, though, maybe there was the sound of bat on pad; and impact was outside off, so no chance of lbw, either. Australia lose their review and Markram continues
pushed through flatter in the channel and blocked coming across
gives it some loop, defended square on off stump
comes across and defends around off stump
round the wicket, full and de Kock drives, times it neatly back past mid-off for a couple
pitched up, 133kph/81mph outside off and punched into the covers
ooh, nicely done, played it late and with an angled bat to slide the ball wide of the slips, picks up four
good length in the corridor outside off and de Kock lets it go
short, at the body and it doesn't quite get up, 135kph and deflected behind square on the leg side
round the wicket, pushed through a touch leg side and he squeezes a thick inside edge fine for two
floated full around off, defended coming across
gives it plenty of air, drifting in and de Kock has to line it up as he defends around his front pad
whoops, this takes off and spins almost square, de Kock hanging back but can't lay bat on it
floated up a touch straighter, tuned to leg
touch short and played safely off the back foot
Markram is offered a bit of width, chopped square off the toe of the bat
gets on to the front foot and shows it a straight bat
back of a length, de Kock flashes at it, comes off the outside edge but doesn't quite carry to gully - and the ball then scoots through Khawaja and away for four!
full in the channel, 133kph and this time it's driven with control through the covers for a couple more
hello, not quite sure de Kock wanted to play that, short outside off and he seem to try and stop himself from cutting, ended up tapping it straight off the face to gully
angling in from round the wicket and de Kock squirts an inside edge for one
floated up full on the stumps, Quinny goes back and tickles it around the corner for one
pushed through on off, 91kph and Markram blocks resolutely
tossed up with overspin and this creeps low, Markram gets the toe of the bat on it and it deflects away to safety
comes down and clips one through mid-on
round the wicket, tapped away square on off stump
angled in flatter and de Kock works it to the leg side
touch short of a length outside off and dabbed down for one
round the wicket, 137kph and defended coming across
back of a length, steered down towards point
drops short and de Kock shapes to cut, maybe stays a fraction low and he ends up bottom-edging into the turf
good length, arrowing in on off stump, de Kock covers well it and blocks towards mid-on
fullish length and pushed back down the ground
nicely bowled, spinning in from outside off but Markram plays the wrong line and is beaten pressing forwards
tossed up straight and tapped down to the leg side
floated full around off stump, smothered
dances down and clubs a drive past the bowler to long-on
round the wicket, angled in and defended
sliding a touch too straight and this is flicked fine for a single
hammered in back of a length from round the wicket, de Kock shows it a doughty straight bat
fuller, 143kph and tailing in a fraction as de Kock drives, comes off the inside half of the bat and bounces up to Cummins in his follow through
good length, worked from off stump towards midwicket but there's no run there
dug in short, wide enough for de Kock to drop his hands and ignore
good length, comes across and plays outside off, pushed square
short outside off and blocked to the leg side
over the wicket, lobbed up out the back of the hand, defended around the front pad
on target again, Markram taps it away
flighted, nice and loopy and gripping a touch, Markram goes hard at it and the ball squirts in the air towards backward point
tossed up fullish around off stump, prodded away to excited murmuring around the bat
full and bunted through mid-on coming forwards
round the wicket, aiming for the rough outside off stump to the left-hander, worked away off the back foot to short fine leg
round the wicket, short and clipped down towards midwicket from the crease

oof, that's a tasty bumper, right up in Markram's grille but this time he manages to defend it down to the off side - unlike in his first innings - the ball juddering the splice with short leg sniffing around
comes across and pushes towards extra cover
fullish in the channel, punched in front of square
short of a length, 134kph and rattled through the covers off the back foot, it was in the air for a while but flew in front of the fielder and away
trundles in one last time and hits the pitch hard, Markram blocks from the crease - and makes it to tea
on the pads first up and clipped through midwicket with nonchalant ease for a couple.
full and moving back in towards middle, a bottom-hand flick to midwicket. Late reverse swing?
full outside off, a full face drive to mid-off
off the leading edge to fine leg. A bouncer around middle, 140 kph, de Kock bails out of the pull late.
on a length on off, defended back
solid as you like! Back of a length, around off, defended
on the pads again, nudged to square leg for one
nailed through cover! Continuing his form from the first two sessions. Overpitched outside off, Markram gets forward and caresses the ball through the gap. Yummy!
good stop from Mitch Marsh this time, 133 kph, on a length outside off, carved towards backward point, where Marsh dives to his left. He is now shunted away to square leg.
full, coming back in, Markram guides to gully.
135 kph, full and wide outside off, a swish and a miss! Looks to drive through cover but makes no contact.
full on off, right behind the line to defend
full and wide outside off, caressed to mid-off from the crease
back of a length outside off, the ball moving back in, de Kock lets the ball come to him before running it off the open face through gully for four. Lovely stroke.
full and wide outside off, driven to mid-off with bad timing
full again, outside off, not much inward movement, pushed to mid-off again
on top of the bounce and pulling to deep square leg. Short around off, pulled away for one

back of a length outside off, a big appeal as Australia think of reviewing! Paine says it has clipped the back trouser, not the outside edge. Just a hint of away movement carried it past the outside edge
four more, runs leaking now, on the pads from Hazlewood and de Kock picks a big gap at midwicket to gather four
overpitched outside off, driven to mid-off with the full face
too straight yet again, four more. Help yourself bowling from Hazlewood. De Kock flicks through midwicket. South Africa's second successive 50-plus stand
good length around off, defended back up the pitch
shortish delivery outside off, guided away to gully
full outside off, caressed through cover, two more. 10 off the over
back of a length around off, Markram is right behind the line to defend
bunted away past mid-off for a couple! Full delivery outside off, Markram just checks his drive but it's a full face so two to mid-off
full and straight, blocked back
through cover for four more. 143 kph outside off and caressed away for four! This is sublime batting. He just leans into a drive, and keeps finding the gaps. On 95
good length delivery outside off, defended, 141 kph. The cheers are getting more raucous, as you would expect at this time of the day.
full delivery outside off, 147 kph, he gets forward and blocks.
good length, wide outside off, chopped to deep point for one
on middle and leg, zoning in on those pads, tickled to square leg
full and straight, moving back in, 142 kph, nudged to midwicket
full outside off, 139 kph, Markram is behind the line, blocks to mid-off
more inward movement, 133 kph, on middle and leg, blocked
five dots to Markram. Short around middle and off, Markram gets underneath
the perfect yorker, quick on middle, swinging back late. But de Kock somehow gets bat on it, his front boot was in line too
another yorker but wide outside off, ends up as a low full toss, driven to mid-off
a very full delivery outside off, seaming back in, pushed to mid-off
through midwicket for one. On the pads, bunted away to that fielder who doesn't get down in time
full on off, 147 kph, blocked
edged and away for four to gully. Markram onto 99. The ball is moving away, Markram defends with soft hands, the ball races away. South Africa bring up 200
beats the outside edge. Angled away, full, lulls de Kock into a drive but there is too much movement.
tapped past gully for four. 134 kph, moving away, opens the bat face and carves the ball. Lots of runs.
full and wide outside off, left alone this time
another good leave, 133 kph, on a fourth-stump channel, no stroke
another carve to gully. One of two gullies. Angling away again
a change in length, Hazlewood goes for the bouncer, 137 kph, off the toe end of the bat into the slip cordon, may have caught the body actually.
full on off, defended into the off side
back of a length on off, right behind the line, 141 kph

that was a badly-judged single but he makes it! Full on off, pushed to mid-on and calls for one. A valiant dive leaves his shirt with gravel on it, but that means Markram gets to a sensational hundred. One of the better fourth-innings hundreds you will see, burdened further by AB's run-out.
into the gap and four. De Kock gets to fifty too. Full and wide, and caressed away into the gap. Starc nullified after tea
four more! 141 kph, full, wide outside off and flies off the outside edge through the vacant gully region. His feet were rooted to the crease but he still finds the gap.
on the pads, nudged to midwicket, 144 kph.
full outside off, 134 kph, a very positive, confident leave.

past backward point, four more. Back of a length outside off, moving away, guided away past the fielder. The target is now under 200! SA's best period of batting this home season, considering the quality of the bowling?
a punchy push in front of point this time. Mitch Marsh labours across to his right to save some runs.
another boundary! Back of a length down leg, looking to nudge but the ball takes the face of the bat and away for four to fine leg.

it definitely hit the helmet! But was there some glove on it too? Smith opts to review. That's a sensational bouncer, aimed for the badge, hits the badge, and lobs to Smith at first slip. He wanted to sway, then duck, then just wore the blow: that's as good a bouncer as you would find. Missed the glove. Australia lose their review, they have none left.

hit again on the body! Back of a length down leg, off the elbow to short leg, who takes the catch and hits the stumps at the batsman's end. Three fielders have their arms up in appeal. The umpires decide there is no appeal. Huge swelling on that elbow, that forearm.
flat on the pads, a thick inside edge to fine leg
on middle and leg, nudged into the gap at midwicket for one
shortish and wide, left alone
against the turn, driven through cover for four more. Lots of flight outside off, Markram leans into the drive, past wide mid-off
too full again, drilled to extra cover
lots of flight, smothered.
beauty! Beats de Kock. Back of a length outside off, the ball moving away. A waft. Beaten.
short around middle, 132 kph, de Kock wanted to flick through square leg but failed to make adequate contact.
shortish and wide, a more forceful cut to deep point for one
pulled away. 137 kph, short down leg, helped along to fine leg. Looks like he will play that shot hereon.
a mis-timed pull off a 139 kph bouncer. Hurried on the pull. This is terrific short-ball bowling on a slow pitch to hurry batsmen in their backyard.
the feet are not there, full outside off, a leaden-footed prod, a thick inside edge evades the stumps, one to fine leg
slow outside off, defended
nudged away to midwicket with the spin
the quicker one, on off, worked to midwicket
too good, as soon as Lyon overpitches, he goes through with the shot. A languid drive through cover for four. So full that he can play against the spin.
short on off, worked to deep midwicket for one.
slow around off, de Kock is right forward to defend
another short delivery, another pull. he is in control of that pull, rolls his wrists and finds the gap behind square. Starc gets across to save two
another pull into the gap behind square. Lyon gets across from deep square leg, but two more.
it is outside off, on a length and punched past cover for two more. The deep point fielder can't stop two.
another short ball, controls the pull down to fine leg for one. Seven off this over.
on the pads, nudged to midwicket
yet another controlled pull, de Kock gets over the bounce and pulls to deep square leg.
tossed up around off, 87 kph, driven to cover
shortish, quicker outside off, guided to backward point
oh well bowled. Sees de Kock coming and shortens the length, but QdK does well to improvise a dab to point.
too short this time, de Kock goes back and slashes the cut through point for another boundary. SA now have 250, another tick in the psychological check list
shortish outside off, carved to point
85 kph, shortish and wide again, cut towards Warner at point, who gets across to his left to stop the ball from going through.
ooh, close to playing on against the persevering Cummins, chopped just past leg stump
comes across on off and steers another single through cover point
good length, poked defensively to backward point
touch shorter and de Kock moves into line and nudges gently towards midwicket
full of a length, 132kph and driven, comes off the inside half of the bat
drags his length back and de Kock stabs it down into the off side
flighted, Markram continues to get forward well and defend
