whoops, nearly done for! This time he hangs back and the ball spins wickedly, beats the inside edge but misses everything and runs for byes
tossed up, props forward, smothers it
flatter trajectory and Markram covers his stumps in defence
pushed through a bit quicker and tapped towards cover
lobbed very full on off stump, Markram is too tired to do anything other than clamp down on it in iron-willed defence
over the wicket now, short of a length and tucked to the leg side from the crease
Cummins charges in and pitches the ball up outside off, gas a bit low now, 130s kph and de Kock drives, picks out extra cover
full and punched on the drive again, Warner can grab it first time in the covers and they scamper through
length ball, Markram is on to the front foot in good order and splunks a couple more in front of the sweeper
banged in, Cummins cranks it up to 142kph and the ball is quickly on Markram as he pulls, comes off the glove/handle and loops behind short leg. On another day...
full length in the channel, inviting the drive and again de Kock strokes it to the man at short extra cover
Lyon floats the ball up wide of the stump, left alone
played with the spin, tapped down and short leg grabs the ball as it threatens to spin away for a single

smashed back at the bowler, Lyon can't get a hand on it! It was at a catchable height, but that's about as close as it was to being a chance, absolutely belted by Markram, umpire Ravi had to dive for cover
pushed through quicker and dabbed away behind square
flat and spinning in, works on more off the hip
more noise around the ground as de Kock presses out and spanks an overpitched delivery through the covers! South Africa's requirement comes down below 150
drops a little short and Markram tucks it off his hip for a single, turning over the scoreboard for a couple more
full, sliding on to the pads and whipped to fine leg
full, it's a juicy half-volley and de Kock laces it straight back whence it came... too straight, as it crashes into the stumps and goes nowhere
pitched up in the corridor, steered towards extra cover
ooh, de Kock swishes and misses! Another tempting drive ball but hung a bit wider and it skips past the edge
comes across and pokes a drive into the off side
floated up and defended around off stump as the ball skids on
flat and run off the face wide of the slip for to third man
stays round the wicket to de Kock, who defends on off
drops a touch short, he rocks back to cut but will only get one through backward point
over the wicket now, tosede up and tapped to the on fisde
floated full and wide of the stumps, Markram leans out and shows it the maker's name once again
sliding across the left-hander, de Kock stays back and angles a single
good length and worked off the hip, they're ticking over without fuss here
four more, de Kock leans back and chops a half-tracker past gully, it races away! The hoots of encouragement around the ground ring out again
full length around off, tapped to mid-off coming forwards
good length, 141kph and nibbling a fraction, solidly blocked
width on offer, de Kock is forward and crouches to slap a cut behind point to the sweeper
tossed up and worked off legs
pushed through outside off and de Kock clips another single through the covers
floated up full and defended coming across
gets a little straighter and Markram tickles it along the carpet to mid-on
pushed through and worked down to the leg side
flat outside off, no turn and Markram pokes it into a gap at point, they trot the single

got him! The dam has been breached, thanks to a fantastic catch standing up to the wicket! Marsh breaks through, Markram's shoulders slump as the Australians celebrate around him! He was trying to run the ball off the face and sent it straight into Tim Paine's gloves, but he did superbly to hold it. The SA team stand in the dressing room to clap him in - it was a fantastic knock, gargling on grit, but as he walks off the light returns to Australian eyes
comes across and taps the ball down safely
short and rising, Philander swipes at it and - fortunately - misses
touch short of a length outside off, prodded down into the covers
sliding down the leg side, another smart take from Paine, standing back now, but no bat on it
fired in full, almost breaches the defences with a reverse-swinging yorker, Philander does well to chop down on it
oh, too good for the batsman, round the wicket and curving like a scimitar away from the bat as Philander reaches for it and is beaten
very full, outside off and Philander chops down on it in defence
length ball, 143kph and shaping away a touch, wide enough for him to leave alone
shortish, Philander jumps into line and jabs it square
speared in full and Philander turns it off the pads
fired in full and flicked away for one through backward square leg
slings it down on a length outside off, Philander watches it by
touch short and clattered past backward point, nicely played by Big Vern, needs a diving save on the rope from Bancroft to prevent it going for four
angled across from over the wicket, de Kock pushes it away to the off side
touch short, 133kph and there's width on offer, cut through point for a single
pitched up and clipped off the pads for one through midwicket
short ball, sits up nicely for the pull but de Kock plinks it somewhat to midwicket
Starc bangs it in and Philander jumps into line

jaffa, Philander nicks off! Starc rips out another with the old ball! Brilliant, searching line, rising to graze the shoulder of the bat... Philander did well to get a touch on it, really. Or not, if you're of a South African persuasion
touch short, he hops into line and defends
play and a miss, feeling for it outside off stump

stumps shattered! Starc the barbarian does it again! Maharaj is helpless here, a reverse-swinging rocket that veers as if by remote control past the groping bat and smashes into middle and off! This spell should come with a Parental Guidance warning

GONE FIRST BALL!! Off stump takes a walk, Australia are one wicket away! Starc is pinpoint accurate once again and Rabada is ushered straight back in the direction he came... although he probably shouldn't have tried to cover drive it
de Kock takes the single straight away, worked off the pads
flighted, gets a leading edge back down the pitch, doesn't carry
Morkel lines it up and blocks
tossed up and again he covers it in defence
angled in and straightening, Morkel blocks doggedly
safely negotiated, tapped back down the track
round the wicket, flighted and worked with the spin to the leg side
tossed up, de Kock smothers it
comes forward and punches the ball back to the bowler
stays back in the crease and works the ball away for a single through square leg
oh, hello Morne, he opens the shoulders and has a mow, miscued along the ground to mid-on
tossed up full wide of the stumps and it bounces from the rough to hit the gloves and then land safely on the pitch
flighted, straightening on off stump, defended
straighter line and worked through the leg side, de Kock decides to keep the strike this time
floated up and worked against the turn into the gap, again he declines the one
pushed through and de Kock cuts in front of square, now he scampers through
floated up on off, Morkel pats it away
full, dipping on the stumps, pushed back towards the bowler, Morkel sees out the over
lobbed up wide of the stumps, de Kock defends as the ball spins in
Smith lets go a big full toss which Quinny bunts down the ground, but declines the one
flighted, spin and bounce from the rough as de Kock defends
leans on to the front foot and defends
floated up, pushed back down the ground coming across
full and tapped back, Smith fields off his own bowling - so Lyon will get a crack at Morkel again
pushed through and he defends with bat thrust out next to pad
fizzed through, quick on off stump, Morkel gets that big stride in and jabs towards cover
off-stump line, presses out and defends
floated up a touch straighter, Morkel knocks it back to the bowler. 'Go again'
pushed through flat on off, more solid defence
full on the pads, Morkel prods at it and Bancroft throws himself full length trying to grab the catch from short leg... Might have been an inside edge on that, you know
over the wicket, tossed up and straightening to hit the pads, concerted appeal from the Australians, S Ravi shakes his head
flighted, outside off and pushed into the covers
gives it some air, driven back down the track and Smith dives to cut it off
round the wicket, loops up an offbreak this time, de Kock is watchful and blocks on middle and leg stump
full, another offie, I think, tucked to the leg side
Smithy dances in again and darts the ball flat on the pads, clipped to short fine leg
Lyon tosses the ball up on the stumps, defended
straightening on middle and off pushed back down the track
pushed through no the stumps and tapped towards mid-on
fires this in from wide on the crease and it grips, beats the outside edge, into the gloves!
off, done him again, spinning through into the gloves as Morkel props forward
tossed up into the rough outside off, legbreaks again and this spins to hit the glove but stays down
flighted, lets this spin in and defends on off
now de Kock sticks out his front pad, kicks the ball away
tossed up and defended
gives the leggie a rip, there's appreciable turn from wide of the stumps as de Kock plays with his pads again
lobbed up and defended from the crease
angled in flat, Morkel keeps the defences up
straighter line and tucked to leg
shout for lbw, but was it straightening enough? Dharmasena doesn't think so, pitching on middle and off, before crashing into the pads, Australia don't have any more reviews
floated up full, tapped back
another solid front-foot block
tossed up around the line of off and Morkel dead-bats it once again

over the wicket, reversing in to de Kock and it strikes the pads, Starc appeals... but it was heading down leg, S Ravi uninterested, so no cherry on the top for Starc. Still needs one for a ten-wicket haul, though
again he slides a fullish ball into the pads as de Kock plays across the line
comes across and gets bat on ball, tickled towards mid-on
full, wide of the off stump, swing and a miss from Quinny
pitched up, 139kph, big swing on the drive but it comes off the inside half of the bat and runs towards mid-on
full again, 143kph and tailing in as de Kock plinks a drive towards point - so a maiden to start with, and de Kock loses the strike
full, 141kph outside off, tapped into the covers
on a length, goes straighter and Morkel plays correctly towards mid-on
short ball, heading down the leg side as he flicks at it and misses
pitched up and Morkel gets those giraffe limbs moving to push into the covers again
dug in short and Morkel starts to follow it but then does well to drop the hands
length ball, aiming for the top of off, Morne drives comfortably to mid-off and sees out the over. Only 88 more to go
angled in on a length, 138kph and de Kock gets a big leading edge that balloons over midwicket, bounces out towards the sweeper... but he declines the run
angled in with the arm, whipped off the pads but again de Kock realises he won't get back for two so doesn't take one
full, 141kph outside off, de Kock drives wide of long-off, sets off this time - possibly wanting two but they won't get it
full, 144kph/89mph in the channel but not coming back enough, Morkel leaves it alone
hello, there's the Starc boomerang, curving with a dangerous beauty out of the hand but it started wide and bent back towards Paine allowing Morkel to leave
fired in straight, clipped square on the leg side off the inside edge - but they won't run
length outside off and de Kock pops it in the air through point, this time they do take the single
round the wicket, pitched up and Morkel goes for an airy swish, fails to connect
full, Morkel slashes a thick outside edge through gully and they pick up three - he's off the mark!

reversing in, smack on the back pad - given! Hazlewood has done it, de Kock looks guilty although he belatedly asks for the review, which pretty much tells the story. Thought there might have been an inside edge, but no, it beat the bat as de Kock drove, would have hit leg stump. So Australia wrap up a 118-run win, finishing the innings off without drama on the final morning
